name: SunsplashedSerenity walk to Harvard & Fresh Pond
description: An elegant, sun-splashed, 2 bedroom (+2offices) apartment with parking, a 15-minute walk or 7-minute bike ride to Harvard (bikes provided).  Enjoy this spacious 1st floor unit in a stylish 3-level house, with its gorgeous yard and two bluestone patios, on a quiet leafy street in Huron Village Cambridge.  Sleeps 5.
neighborhood_overview:
Huron Village is known for its charm. We have playgrounds, a reservoir, small artisans, a used bookstore, antiques, and two bakery-cafes all within walking distance of Harvard Square. You'll also find scrumptious take-out in several local places. (URL HIDDEN)
(URL HIDDEN)
host_about: I'm a professor at one of the local universities and a long-time Cambridge resident.  I live on the second floor at 64 Granville Road with my daughter.  We enjoy sharing our "Cambridge tips" with all of our visitors: where to ice-skate in winter or rent a canoe in summer, the best local places for cheese, bread, and yummy ethnic take-out treats.  We can lend you bikes and direct you to the Minuteman Bikeway, an 11-mile shady ride through Arlington, Lexington and Bedford, or give you a couple of sleds and show you the hill at Fresh Pond.  Whatever the season, we look forward to welcoming you when you're in Cambridge.

name: Lovely Studio Room: Available for long w/ends
description: Large sunny room w kitchenette & bath. Foam mat can be added for 3rd person. Must love rescue dogs; Callie is a gem; likes pets when you come and go. Quality queen mattress, fridge, microwave, good wifi, en-suite marble bath. Quiet, leafy Cambridge neighborhood, moments from city life. Walk, bike or bus to Harvard, Tufts, MIT, Lesley . **Must like kids, adorable ones live above & you will hear their footsteps at times. Covid Vaccination. No lock on room or use of other rooms.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet and friendly and our street is tree-lined, and known as one of the nicest blocks in what is a great neighborhood. It's far enough away from the main street so you won't hear any noise, yet within moments you can be at the subway or in Davis or Porter Squares. there's a sweet playground nearby, a bike trail extending 19 miles, and many parks. A Whole Foods and Trader Joe's are both within a 15 minute walk.
host_about: Friendly, politically progressive, resourceful... I love hosting people from all over the world, and know the area well for a native NY'er. You will find the environment 'on the court' restful, peaceful and as one  guest from put it, "I  figured you were a healer of some sort-- because your home feels healing." Our place is relaxing and down to earth, with  an artistic and colorful ambiance, and lots of sunlight.

name: Cambridge Getaway @ Harvard & MIT
description: Charming 2-bedroom apartment on the third floor of our beautiful Victorian home.
neighborhood_overview: Annmarie and I have lived in this area for over 50 years. We both live on the first floor of this house and know where people want to go. We can suggest the best restaurants and attractions in the neighborhood.
host_about: Annmarie and I were both born here in Cambridge. We have lived in the same location our entire lives. It is a wonderful area for visiting the city..We started with Airbnb for 4 years now and it has been a wonderfull experience. Many people have stayed here from all over the world.. Marathons, Graduations, Reunions and Family get togethers. We are surrounded by Great restaurant's and cafe's.. We are 5 minutes to bus lines and the Redline. You can walk to Harvard or MIT in 10-15 minutes Walkability has a 95% rating. We also have free parking.

name: East Cambridge Apartment
description: Our four bedroom home is tucked away in a wonderful neighborhood in East Cambridge.  Walk to great neighborhood restaurants and enjoy day trips to Boston with easy access to bus and train lines.  Enjoy the backyard and charm of Cambridge.
neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood is tucked away behind MIT and Kendall Square.  East Cambridge still has a strong Portuguese population that is apparent with grape vines surrounding our yard.  Our oldest son goes to school down the street and we love the community and our neighborhood.
host_about:
My wife and I are teachers north of Boston and have 4 children.  We enjoy traveling, being active, and spending time in Cape Cod and Lake Ontario.
  
As a family we enjoy seeing different places and experiencing different cultures.  We love the concept of airbnb and the idea of communal living.  As a young family we love the idea of living somewhere else and having the flexibility/comforts of a kitchen and yard.

name: Elegant Comfort near T. Private Entrance.
description:
Wonderfully located, spacious & immaculate, the apartment is the second floor of an 1890's two-family home with high ceilings and big windows. There are two bedrooms, a separate study with a desk and bed, two bathrooms, and a third bedroom available (at an additional charge.)
The amazing neighborhood offers great restaurants, markets and shops --there's something interesting for everyone to do. You don't need a car since the subway entrance is nearby, but one driveway parking space is included.
neighborhood_overview:
Please remember that the AirBnB "pins" do not show you exact listing locations. We are a three-four minute walk to Davis Square and the subway in one direction, and also a two-three minute walk to the grocery store and bus on Mass Ave in the other direction.
Our location offers very easy access to Harvard, Tufts, Cambridge, Arlington and Boston. There are children's playgrounds within a short walk, and a public beach within a short drive. Davis Square, right at the next corner, is a destination in itself.
Here's a portion of an article from the Boston Globe about Davis Square:

Somerville crossroads lives up to its hip image

“We’ve come from a foreign land called suburbia,” a mother joked to her two highly energized toddlers as they darted about on the busy sidewalks of Davis Square. On a sunny Saturday afternoon, urban bohemians and families alike swarmed into this hipster beehive to purge their cabin fever.

Sandwiched between Tufts Universit
host_about:
Richard is an artist. I worked as a residential designer/builder for years, and now I write about it. I also consult with non-profit organizations about strategic planning,
We love to travel as well, and also have a home on Prince Edward Island in Canada.  Where-ever we go, I like to cook and dance.

name: Quiet, Artistically Decorated Cambridge Apartment
neighborhood_overview: Our street is a beautiful quiet tree lined street that does not get a lot of car traffic since it is not a through street from major roads.  There are several parks close by- a large one that is great for jogging, soccer, softball, track and smaller ones that with newly renovated playground equipment and water features for hot days.
host_about: I have lived in this house for almost 30 years and have renovated almost every square inch of it.  I have two daughters who have graduated college (Colorado College & Princeton) and a son who graduated from Harvard College in 2022.  I love cycling, rowing, walks, yoga, cooking, making art and hanging out with family and friends.

name: See Yourself in Central Square
host_about:
I spent most of my adult life traveling around the globe from my home base in Portland,Oregon... sometimes staying in people's house, sometimes just a hammock between two trees.  I am currently indoctrinating my son to like these things so we can hit the road when he gets a wee bit older.  My last trip was across India by bicycle.  Good fun if you get the chance!

Since I've been in Cambridge, I've learned things that would be not possible while traveling, learning the guitar, making beer, perfecting my jerk chicken burritos...and I've grown to love this town...lively music scene, and the biking is getting better and better!

name: Home on quiet street near Harvard
description:
Bedroom with double bed, desk, closet, wi-fi, and two windows. Bathroom for guest(s) only. Kitchen has breakfast supplies and storage space for guest(s) but also used by owner and occasionally family members.
Minimum of three nights booking reservations.
host_about:
I have lived in my house in Cambridge for more than forty years, during which I have shared the space with family and first-floor tenants. Though my children are grown, I love my neighborhood and appreciate the sense of community.  I know well the advantages of this location, and I always enjoy connecting people with historic and cultural resources. In keeping with these enthusiasms, I volunteer as a guide at deCordova Sculpture Park and Museum in Lincoln and participate in projects at a community art center near my house.  I post about art in the Boston area on a blog called ART OUTDOORS. 
 (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

Currently a freelance writer and editor of educational materials, I keep a home office but still have one guest room that is not used often enough.  I think the room would prove to be a comfortable base for someone attending a conference or exploring the Boston area. 
I am vaccinated and boosted and try to follow whatever masking, testing, and cleaning guidelines are current.
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Mid-Cambridge Charmer - Avail for Academic Year
description: - Enjoy the comfort & convenience of my cozy 1 bedroom, on a quiet street in Mid Cambridge. With lots of light, hardwood floors, french doors, a beautiful kitchen & 2 decks. Minutes to Harvard, MIT & public transportation. Minimum stay is 4 weeks. No parking.
neighborhood_overview: Mid- Cambridge is a beautiful neighborhood of Victorian houses and tree lined streets.   Convenient to everything - half way btween Harvard & Central Sqs. Enjoy excellent dining, entertainment, site seeing & seasonal events. Everything you need is near by including grocery stores, library, post office, drug stores, cafes, banks, hubway bikes, Charles River.
host_about: Hi, I am Melissa. I grew up in historic Lexington Mass and studied Art History and Art Education. I make sculpture out of recycled computer parts out of a Maker Space called the Artisan's Asylum in Somerville and teach people of all ages. I put my heart and soul into renovating my condo and turned it into the dream home I always wanted! I love the back porch and back yard. It is the most relaxing place to hang out on a hot summer day! I rent to Harvard and MIT affiliates. Many international scholars have stayed in my condo.  Come visit MA. I live around the block and would be happy to give suggestions of what to see and do on your visit!

name: Harvard/MIT/BU/Central Square Room
description:
The Room includes a Bed, Desk, closet, remote overhead dimming light and Air conditioner.

The apartment is a 3 bedroom 1 bath on the second and third floor of a 2 family house.

When more than one guest is present the bathroom is cleaned weekly and the entire house is cleaned every other week.

This listing is for one of the 2 rooms in the photos not both.

I'm a software dev who has lived in Cambridge for many years & love all my town offers

Happy to offer local recommendations:
bike trails, kayaking & other outdoor activities (especially nature outings — the Charles River is 3 blocks away!), whale watching, comedy, museums, cultural events

You're also welcome to use my fleet of renovated bikes for exploring, free of charge

I’m always reachable for anything that will make your stay comfortable

name: Great Room Near Harvard/MIT/BU, bikes available
description:
The Room includes a Bed, Desk, closet, remote overhead dimming light and Air conditioner.

The apartment is a 3 bedroom 1 bath on the second and third floor of a 2 family house.

When more than one guest is present the bathroom is cleaned weekly and the entire house is cleaned every other week.

Bike with helmet and lock is available during your stay.

This listing is for one of the 2 rooms in the photos not both.
host_about:
I'm a software dev who has lived in Cambridge for many years & love all my town offers

Happy to offer local recommendations:
bike trails, kayaking & other outdoor activities (especially nature outings — the Charles River is 3 blocks away!), whale watching, comedy, museums, cultural events

You're also welcome to use my fleet of renovated bikes for exploring, free of charge

I’m always reachable for anything that will make your stay comfortable

name: MIT/Harvard/Inman- 2 Bedroom Apt.
description:
First floor apartment located in our 2 family home. Located in vibrant and hip Inman Square. 5 minute walk to the New Union Square Green Line T stop.

I live in a separate apartment upstairs with my husband and 2 children.

City of Cambridge Inspected and Licensed as a LEGAL short term rental apartment.

Registration No. STR-14611 with the City of Cambridge,MA
neighborhood_overview: What is not to love about Inman Square!! Tons of Restaurants and still maintaining a neighborhood feel. There are 2 WholeFoods Markets within a 10 minute walk.
host_about:
I am married and a mom to two amazing children and an Airbnb host since 2012. I was the Chef/Owner of two award winning restaurants in Boston prior to having children. My husband Chad is an Engineer. 

 Cambridge has been our home for over 20 years and is an amazing place to live and raise a family.

name: Quiet private room in N. Cambridge
description:
I DO require all guests to be up to date with their Covid 19 vaccinations including having an updated booster..

Quiet room w/ futon and couch, desk (not a work desk) , and closet.

Bus to Harvard Square leaves just around the corner. It's about a 10 to 14 minute ride depending on the time of day, and there is a subway connection there.There is also a subway stop about a 13 minute walk from my place.

I have a lot of hosting experience and can provide good tips on an individual's interests.
neighborhood_overview: This was the working class neighborhood of Cambridge, the area where former speaker of the house, Tip O'Neil, grew up. A lot of condos have gone up in the neighborhood. It's an area that borders Arlington and Somerville, and Belmont and Watertown are also very close.
host_about:
I am a senior and may be immune compromised so please be advised I can only accommodate guests who have an updated COVID booster or pledge to get it at least 2 weeks before their arrival date. Proof is needed.

I am passionate about music including music from many different areas of the world. I've traveled extensively on a budget and am very resourceful helping those who may have a limited budget to find things to do that they can afford.

name: Minutes to Harvard Square
description: This is a newly-updated well-maintained 2 bedroom condo unit in a classic Cambridgian triple decker house setting. We are located on the first floor (or 'ground floor' in European terms).  There is a separate front entrance to our unit.  The condo is located in Strawberry Hill, the quietest and safest residential neighborhood in Cambridge, 1.5 miles west of Harvard Square. Away from subway metro stops but accessible to the station with four frequent bus lines. Great amenities by foot.
neighborhood_overview: very quiet and family oriented. Free street parking directly in front of the house. Walkable to public library, playgrounds, supermarkets, restaurants and outdoor tennis/golf/running trails. Car rental within 1 mile.
host_about: I live between two coasts. I love to travel, and I'm quite easy going.  I've spent my formative years in various continents, experienced to various cultures.

name: Victorian Charm MIT/Harvard/Kendall/Central-1BR
description: Welcome to our 100-year-old house! Cozy, friendly and full of charm. Very convenient to MGH. Our location is hard to beat: close to both subway and bus with many excellent restaurants in walking distance. Convenient for functions at MIT or Harvard. Located in Central Square, we are an easy walk to Kendall and Inman Squares. For runners and walkers, the Charles River paths are 0.5 mile away. This unit features hardwood floors and nine foot ceilings. The private back deck is very popular.
neighborhood_overview:
Despite our urban setting, our neighborhood is very quiet, particularly at bedtime. It has always been the kind of neighborhood where women can walk alone safely at night. Generally speaking, this side of the river is dramatically calmer than the Boston side though now bustling with a nice variety of great restaurants.

We actively recycle. There is a blue bin in the unit. Or, we can do it for you if you simply keep glass, plastic and metal trash together and separated from trash. We also keep a compost container in the fridge for vegetable trash. We'll empty it into the big bin outside when you leave.
host_about:
We are a pair of classical musicians in Cambridge, located between MIT & Harvard. As with much of Cambridge, we're hopeless lefties. 

On parle un peu de français. Hablamos poco español. Und ein bisschen Deutsch auch.

Most Sundays you'll find us "making a joyful noise" at one church or another.
We've been in this old house and this neighborhood over 20 years now. Since we cook a bit, the rental floor fridge and pantry might contain a little overflow from ours. We're huge fans of Airbnb both as guests and as hosts. Leave your towels and sheets at home; we provide all that for you. Our biggest challenge as Airbnb hosts is saying goodbye to the awesome people who stay with us.

name: Cambridge Apt, walk to MIT, Harvard
description: Private, sunny, top floor and a half of owner-occupied 19th century row house. The house is tucked away on a private lane minutes from Central Square and public transportation (subway and bus), restaurants, pubs, and two grocery stores. MIT is a 12-min walk, or one subway stop in one direction, and Harvard is a 20-min walk, or one subway stop, in the other direction. The flat gets lots of sun, and has a fully equipped eat-in kitchen and full bath.  No TV, but good Wifi.
host_about: I've lived in Cambridge for 12 years and am an AIRBNB host.

name: Renovated Brownstone - MIT/Kendall Square
description:
Cozy private room and bath in a renovated brownstone in East Cambridge. GREAT LOCATION! Near MIT, MGH, Charles River with easy access to everything Boston and Cambridge have to offer.

For our safety and that of our guests, we can only accept requests from fully COVID vaccinated guests. Please confirm this when booking. Also, please provide us with some information about the purpose of trip and your travel plans. This helps us better meet your needs. Thanks in advance!
neighborhood_overview:
LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!

If you are going to visit Boston and Cambridge, this is the place to stay. I am located in East Cambridge - near Kendall Square, MIT, Harvard, Massachusetts General Hospital, and Boston - with easy access to everything Boston and Cambridge have to offer. The Museum of Science, the Galeria Mall, and the Charles River are a short 3-5 block walk and there are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby.
host_about:
I have been hosting with Airbnb in my home since 2013 and am delighted to be back in business after our year of a COVID hiatus. Having received my second COVID vaccine, I am beginning to see a light at the end of this tunnel. I hope you are doing well and ready to travel again. New England is a great place to visit so I look forward to meeting you soon!

A little bit about me…
Originally from Florida, I found my way to New England via Spain where I lived and worked for 10 years! I have resided in Cambridge for the past 16 years and love everything it has to offer. I know the city well and can give you tips on things to do, places to see, and where to eat! 

My partner, Steve, and I are both retired from the education field. I was a Spanish teacher and he retired as a library director. We love to travel, cook, and spend time with friends and family.  

Hope you will plan to visit, we would love to host you.

name: Nice room, Porter Square / Harvard
description: Located in Porter Square Cambridge, you are minutes from most of Cambridge including Harvard, Lesley, and Tufts. Restaurants, stores and subway all within a few blocks of your front door. Or visit downtown Boston just 15 minutes by subway or taxi.
neighborhood_overview:
Porter Square is a great neighborhood for all different types of dining. Great options to enjoy a glass of wine or cocktail alone or with a friend. For even greater variety visit Davis Square or Harvard Square within walking distance.
Safe neighborhood with convenient transportation, dining and shopping.
host_about: I think you will find me easy going with a good sense of humor. Happy to tell you about the area and make suggestions on places to go and where to eat. I was transplanted from Minneapolis to Cambridge several years back. I like to travel and usually get some place new each year. Sailing, biking and paddle boarding draw me to the outdoors. Technology Project Management and Operations has kept me busy during the week.

name: 2 Cozy Rooms Near Harvard Square
description:
COVID IN FORMATION: IN ADDITION TO STRICT CLEANING PROTOCOLS WE ARE A FULLY VACCINATED HOUSEHOLD.

Our lovely and spacious Victorian home is located on a quiet one way street between Harvard and Inman Squares. A fifteen minute walk will bring you to historic Harvard Square where the subway can transport you to downtown Boston in under 10 minutes.

During peak spring and summer stays a minimum of 3 nights is required.
neighborhood_overview: Proximity to Harvard (0.8 miles) and Inman Squares, great restaurants within walking distance, interesting architecture.
host_about:
I am a retired pediatric nurse practitioner married to a cabinetmaker who loves to travel (especially to Italy)! I love meeting new people from around the world and helping them to fully experience my wonderful home town of Cambridge/Boston. I am a foodie and can steer you to fabulous restaurants (many of them walking distance from my home).
My kids are grown so I now have 2 comfortable, peaceful rooms available to guests.
Looking forward to meeting you!

name: Serene & cozy 1BR oasis, walk to  Harvard Square!
description:
Tastefully decorated apartment on tree-lined street just outside Inman Square in Cambridge.
Located conveniently near the Cambridge Public Library, Harvard, MIT and many restaurants/cafes.
15 minute walk to Harvard and Central Square (redline).
neighborhood_overview: Just outside Inman Square in a safe and tree-lined neighborhood, we are in walking distance to a number of great restaurants and cafes, independent grocery shops (and two Whole Foods), the beautiful Main Branch of the Cambridge Public Library, two pharmacies, a hospital, parks and playgrounds.
host_about:
I'm an artist/educator splitting my time between Cambridge and Heath, MA and Leipzig, Germany. 
In addition to art, I love hiking and camping, yoga, and gluten-free cooking.

name: Holistic Living Center
description: This ample bedroom is on the first floor and is a comfortable space. The kitchen and bath are shared. All utilities and wi-fi, cable tv, and linens included. Minimum stay: 61 nights. Located in a first floor apartment that doubles as a small urban retreat center. Open to all ages, creeds, and colors, and rainbow friendly. We have a meditation room and weekly potluck suppers which our guests are invited to.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is residential yet quite vibrant and has many services within walking distance. Two blocks in one direction is the wonderful café Sofra with homemade confections and middle eastern dishes. One block in the other direction is Shangri-La: an excellent Chinese restaurant. Two blocks away is Greg's, a neighborhood Italian eatery with full bar and early bird specials. Also within a block are a well stocked liquor store/wine shop, a middle eastern bakery, and a dry cleaners. If you want to walk five blocks to Coolidge Square there is a tasty vegetarian restaurant (Red Lentil), a great diner (Town Diner), a tiny but very good middle eastern eatery (Jasmine), and a super coffee/lunch spot (Uncommon Grounds). A supermarket (Shaws) is four blocks away. A jogging trail around Fresh Pond is six blocks away as is a very nice nine hole golf course. All of this only a ten minute bus ride from Harvard Square!
host_about: I am a long time Cambridge resident having come here originally to attend Harvard Divinity School. I'm a residential real estate agent practicing in Cambridge and Boston. I co-own a three-family residence in Fresh Pond Cambridge and rent out two rooms and a studio through airbnb at my residence where I also reside. I'm interested in health and help run a small meditation and holistic health group out of the first floor apartment in addition to the room rentals. My interests also include gardening, interior design, travel golf, and of course hosting on airbnb! I like providing beautiful and comfortable spaces for my guests to enjoy. I own an RV and love to go camping to the mountains and seashore with my friends and especially my grandchildren. My favorite travel destinations are New Orleans, Savannah, Georgia, and Palm Springs California. I like all kinds of foods and especially my veggies, and I'll give you my cole slaw recipe; grate a cabbage and some carrots, add a grated fresh anise and an apple to the mix, then add some organic cider vinegar and olive oil mayo to taste (this mix tastes so good, you can try it without mayo). My musical tastes are also wide and include jazz, pop, and a cappela.

name: Spacious Cambridge 1BR near Kendall Square & MIT
description: Our apartment is located in Watermark Kendall West, one of the most exciting places to live, work, shop & play in the Boston area. At this community, there is an array of amenities such as a mezzanine terrace with a garden, fitness center and more.
neighborhood_overview: Live in the most exciting and vibrant neighborhood of Massachusetts. Kendall Square is a brimming area with cutting edge technology, science, design, innovation, creative restaurants, and fist-class shopping and is only a couple of metro stations away from downtown Boston. Take a few steps down the street and wander around the renowned Massachusetts Institute of Technology campus. Continue the knowledge tour at the Harvard University campus, where you’ll find peace and relax in its beautiful gardens and historic buildings. Unwind at the Charles River banks and enjoy the fantastic Boston views, where many trails and bike paths offer a haven to enjoy nature and a healthy lifestyle. Just across the Charles River you will be in downtown Boston surrounded by its gorgeous Revolution-era architecture and historic landmarks. The apartment is located in a modern high-rise boasting spectacular views and world-class resident amenities including a fitness center, a Zen garden, a clubhouse, and ful
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Bright Convenient Apt Harvard / MIT
description:
This 600 sf apt with roof deck on the third floor of an old Victorian home is bright and airy. Surrounded trees it does become a sanctuary, a place to call "home". Centrally located and within walking distance to MIT, Novartis, Harvard. It is within minutes walk to the Central Sq subway, station.

The apartment is efficiently laid out with a loft feel. It has a bedroom with king size bed, bath, kitchen, and living area with a ligne roset pullout couch/bed, plus a 230 feet deck.
neighborhood_overview:
In Central Square, easy access to lots of restaurants and bars. walking distance to Inman Square, Kendall Sq, Harvard Sq. Minutes to downtown on the subway. Easy access to zip cars and hubway bicycle service. There are three grocery stores within 5 minutes, Whole Foods, H-Mart and Harvest Coop.

There are a few drinking places; the Fields, Phoenix Landing, the Druid (Inman Sq) and Plough and Stars. They all serve food.

Restaurants are also abundant. It has a concentration of ethnic restaurants. For Indian, Central Square has Shalimar, India Pavilion and many others. There is Central Kitchen, Viale, Oleana, Ole, Casa Portugal, Dumpling House (Chinese) and Four Burgers. Flour is a short walk toward MIT and is known for its baked good and breakfast.
host_about: Architect who dabbles in making things.

neighborhood_overview: Cambridgeport is beautiful.  Anywhere you walk is nice.  We have lots of parks and a brand new park a block away with a year round skating rink!
host_about:
Social worker by training, local shop keeper by profession. We've lived here for over 17 years, have a daughter and dog!  We love Cambridge and would be happy to share things to do around town.

name: Charming Harvard Victorian
description:
Charming Victorian a 10 minute walk or 5 min trolley ride to Harvard square. Close to MIT and Harvard.

Nestled up to Harvard sq. our home has stunning old charm with great period character and one off street parking space.
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled up to Harvard and surrounds the neighborhood is quiet, well established, and beautiful with a lot of history and many famous residents past and current.

Located in the neighborhood of Cambridge called Huron Village, the home is blocks away from the historic Longfellow house, Harvard, Radcliff, Leslie and the entire area exudes Victorian charm.

There is easy and quick access to local stores, tree lines streets, and it offers exceptionally easy access to all things Cambridge and Boston, no car required!
host_about:
I love anything with a story behind it.  I really enjoy any sort of cultural event and great conversation.

In Phoenix, we have tried to provide the perfect sanctuary to get away and yet still see everything the city has to offer for events, shopping, dining, and natural beauty.  North Scottsdale near Kierland is absolutely the perfect location to be.

In Cambridge/Boston we are working with a 124-year-old Victorian.    It's beautiful with a lot of New England charm.   Many homes of the type in the area are gut remodeled and turned into condos or modern style living spaces.  We are working hard to maintain its hand-built Victorian charm while greening its infrastructure where possible and protecting it for future generations.   It's literally an antique we feel more like stewards than owners of.

We are now sharing these homes with others and using any money we earn to further the renovation projects.   We hope to meet people that will continue with us on this journey and get to enjoy things each time they come back as we further improve the spaces for all to enjoy.

neighborhood_overview: Inman Square/East Cambridge is a great walkable neighborhood.  Many restaurants, bars, and parks nearby.

name: Lux 1 Bedroom Cambridge Apt by MIT
description: Our apartment is located in Watermark Kendall West, one of the most exciting places to live, work, shop & play in the Boston area. At this community, there is an array of amenities such as a mezzanine terrace with a garden, fitness center and more.
neighborhood_overview: Live in the most exciting and vibrant neighborhood of Massachusetts. Kendall Square is a brimming area with cutting edge technology, science, design, innovation, creative restaurants, and fist-class shopping and is only a couple of metro stations away from downtown Boston. Take a few steps down the street and wander around the renowned Massachusetts Institute of Technology campus. Continue the knowledge tour at the Harvard University campus, where you’ll find peace and relax in its beautiful gardens and historic buildings. Unwind at the Charles River banks and enjoy the fantastic Boston views, where many trails and bike paths offer a haven to enjoy nature and a healthy lifestyle. Just across the Charles River you will be in downtown Boston surrounded by its gorgeous Revolution-era architecture and historic landmarks. The apartment is located in a modern high-rise boasting spectacular views and world-class resident amenities including a fitness center, a Zen garden, a clubhouse, and ful
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

neighborhood_overview: Enjoy all that Cambridge can offer (just about anything you can think of) without worrying about how to get there or having to carry anything with you: you can always stop by home for a few minutes of relaxation, have a meal delivered to you, check the internet, use your own facilities.... and then hop back into the swing of New England living. name: Large Bedroom + Full Private Bath
description:
A large bedroom plus a private FULL bath, located on a separate level of a new townhouse, in the heart of Cambridge (Central Square). It is within walking distance of the Harvard & MIT campuses and all the bars, restaurants, and groceries. Ideal for someone who's on the go; but desires a prime location, quality, and quiet place to crash at night!

** Before making a reservation, first message me, telling me about yourself & acknowledging the house rules described in "Other details to note."
neighborhood_overview: If you have never been to the Boston area before, Central Square is a prime location between Harvard & MIT in the heart of Cambridge. It's within walking distance from both campuses, with many bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and grocery stores (WholeFood, Trader Joe's, and H Mart) nearby.
host_about: I wear two hats in the Airbnb world: I’m both a guest and a host. Originally hailing from Toronto, Canada, I’ve been a proud resident of Cambridge, Massachusetts since 2008. As a Harvard Alumni, my adventures take me to far-flung corners of the globe. Post-COVID, I’ve embraced remote work, allowing me to operate from the cozy confines of my home. Oh, and my loyal companion? A German Shepherd who faithfully shadows my every move!

name: West Cambridge, 1 BR in House near Harvard
description:
There is 1 bedroom with 2 single beds.

The Queen Anne style house circa 1870's is in a quiet neighborhood, with pleasant walks near the Charles River. Nearby, on Concord Avenue, are buses to Harvard Square and public transport to Boston and other areas.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is residential with a mixture of families with children, Harvard students and  professional people.   Our streets are not busy except in the morning and early evening hours when there is more street traffic. There are a few restaurants and a grocery store on nearby Huron Avenue, 2 blocks away. Many more restaurants and pubs can be found on Massachusetts Avenue and in Harvard, Central, Porter and Davis Squares .   During the day, the pleasantries of hearing children when they come out for recess from the two schools a block away is a happy sound, for me anyway.  Harvard University is  on the perimeter of our neighborhood.  M.I.T and other universities are easily reached by public transportation.
host_about:
I grew up in the Boston area,  lived in Europe and many years in Argentina and still have family there.

Interests cover much from enjoyment of nature, environmental concerns, sports and cultural venues. 

Porcelain painting, writing, photography, music and theatre satisfy artistic desires.   

I enjoy traveling, interacting with people of different backgrounds and countries.  It is one of the most satisfying learning experiences.

name: Large Room in Spacious Apartment, Bikes available
description:
The room includes a Queen Bed, dresser, desk with monitors and chair, 42-inch tv with Chromecast, and air conditioner.

The apartment is a 3 bedroom 1 bath on the second and third floor of a 2 family house.

When more than one guest is present the bathroom is cleaned weekly and the entire house is cleaned every other week.

Bikes (of various sizes) with helmets and locks are available during your stay.
neighborhood_overview: It's located in a great neighborhood a few blocks from the river, public transportation(Buses, Red and Green Line trains)  and grocery stores.
host_about:
I'm a software dev who has lived in Cambridge for many years & love all my town offers

Happy to offer local recommendations:
bike trails, kayaking & other outdoor activities (especially nature outings — the Charles River is 3 blocks away!), whale watching, comedy, museums, cultural events

You're also welcome to use my fleet of renovated bikes for exploring, free of charge

I’m always reachable for anything that will make your stay comfortable

name: "Green" House + parking Harvard/MIT
description: Come and stay at our beautiful house in Cambridge. We have a state-of-the-art kitchen and remodeled bathrooms.  There is free parking in our driveway, and we are very close to the T (Kendall Square or Lechmere Station). We also have a cute backyard.
neighborhood_overview: We consider our neighborhood a suburban sanctuary within the city!  The area is extremely quiet and safe, consisting mainly of families with children or working professionals.  Within a 5-10 minute walk, you have access to a supermarket, a shopping plaza, plenty of cafes, restaurants, and pubs, a movie theatre, a park, and car/bike rentals.
host_about:
We are working professionals in our late 30's.  We are high school sweethearts and attended UCLA together.  We moved to the Boston area in 2012.  

Charlton works in the Information Technology field and got his MBA from Boston University.  Theresa is an elementary school teacher at a charter school.  We love traveling, hiking, eating healthy, exploring new places, watching movies, reading, and meeting new people.  We have been hosting off and on for the past decade, and would love for you to stay at our beautiful house!

This second floor apartment is situated a short distance from MIT, steps away from Kendall Square and very close to public transportation to get to Harvard Square, the Charles River and Boston. Walking distance to great restaurants.
You will be given a 4 digit code that will allow you to come and go as you please. We understand how hard it is to travel with kids so we are equipped for young families with pack & plays, a stroller and portable high chair.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in a wonderful neighborhood between Kendall and Inman Square.   There are quality bars, restaurants and an ample amount of parks within walking distance.

name: West Cambridge 2BR: Pet OK, A/C, backyard, lovely!
description:
Beautiful 2BR/1BA in quiet West Cambridge with deck and backyard... small pet-friendly!

House is on a residential street 1/2 block from Fresh Pond, a tranquil 2.5 mile loop providing drinking water to all of Cambridge.

Your unit is the entire first floor of a two-family house. It is the winter home of an older couple who Airbnb it during the warmer months when they are traveling. Only two private bedrooms, but plenty of room for air beds.

Kids upstairs! Not great for very light sleepers.
neighborhood_overview:
West Cambridge is all the convenience of Cambridge with... an actual backyard!

Our street is very quiet, mostly families, and minutes from Fresh Pond, a lovely 2.5 mile loop around a reservoir which is off-leash dog friendly.

Minutes from Belmont, Watertown, Cambridge, and Somerville hot spots.

Free, ample street parking.
host_about: CEO, Yard Stick - we measure soil carbon!

name: Quiet Studio near MIT, BU & Harvard
description: Our private studio apt. is in an antique home on a quiet street. It has a main room with a queen-sized wall bed, a full bath & a kitchen. 10 minute walk to Central Square 'T' station, BU bridge, Trader Joe's and Whole Foods. WiFi & AC.
neighborhood_overview: Cambridgeport is a quiet, residential neighborhood with a lot of history. There are 5 parks within a 10 minute walk. Central Square is our closest square - a 10 minute walk north. The Charles River and BU Bridge are a 10 minute walk south.
host_about: We have lived in Cambridge MA for over 30 years. We love the New England area and embrace all four seasons as well as the food and activities that come with them. In addition to loving this area, we both like to travel as much as we can. After all the years in Cambridge, we still love to discover new restaurants and activities in the Boston area and are looking forward to sharing those places with you when you come to visit. Our apartment is close to farmers' markets, interesting bars and restaurants, and public transportation to go anywhere in Boston or Cambridge. We are a 10 minute walk to the Charles River and its hike and bike paths as well as several Hubway bike rental spots. We'll happily loan you helmets! You can walk to Harvard, MIT and BU from our central location and even downtown Boston is only a little over a 1/2 hour walk. There's so much to see and do in this historic and interesting neighborhood. Come visit!

name: Lux 2 Bedroom Cambridge Apt by MIT
description: Our apartment is located in Watermark Kendall West, one of the most exciting places to live, work, shop & play in the Boston area. At this community, there is an array of amenities such as a mezzanine terrace with a garden, fitness center and more.
neighborhood_overview: Live in the most exciting and vibrant neighborhood of Massachusetts. Kendall Square is a brimming area with cutting edge technology, science, design, innovation, creative restaurants, and fist-class shopping and is only a couple of metro stations away from downtown Boston. Take a few steps down the street and wander around the renowned Massachusetts Institute of Technology campus. Continue the knowledge tour at the Harvard University campus, where you’ll find peace and relax in its beautiful gardens and historic buildings. Unwind at the Charles River banks and enjoy the fantastic Boston views, where many trails and bike paths offer a haven to enjoy nature and a healthy lifestyle. Just across the Charles River you will be in downtown Boston surrounded by its gorgeous Revolution-era architecture and historic landmarks. The apartment is located in a modern high-rise boasting spectacular views and world-class resident amenities including a fitness center, a Zen garden, a clubhouse, and ful
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: “Bed & Bar” w/Peloton & Street Parking
description:
1 Private Bedroom (Sleep number queen bed) with a shared bathroom.

This room is great for travelers who enjoy sharing a space. The only other bedroom is occupied by hosts, Marisa & Bryan. No other guests share the space.

Our apartment is a 7 minute walk to Davis Sq. with restaurants, bars and access to the Red Line to get downtown in 5 stops.
neighborhood_overview:
It's a wonderful neighborhood of mostly families on a quiet tree-lined street. There are tennis and basketball courts a short walk away as well as a great market (Pemberton Market) which is a 5 minute walk away for fresh produce, unique wine and craft beer.

Davis is a 6 minute walk and Porter square is a 10 minute walk. Both are on the red line.
host_about:
Hello!
We met while Marisa was an AirBnb host in Florida back in 2013 and have hosted collectively for 10 years.

We have traveled the world together, attended & spoken at Airbnb’s international conferences, and hosted over 1000 guests. 

We created the honeymoon couples free stay program and are thrilled to continue offering our home through Airbnb’s valentines campaign.  

Bryan manages a bar & restaurant having started a pop up speak easy pre Covid & Marisa owns a small business.

description:
Sunny studio apt - cozy sanctuary in beautiful, historic neighborhood

Full kitchen -Sleeps 4 in beds plus one in single cot - Large deck-Hi-speed Internet - W/D-Off road parking for one car

Hvd Sq access - Near MBTA bus lines

Close to wooded, scenic reservoir and shops

name: Quiet home near Porter, Harvard. On Red Line
description:
2 bedroom + office/bed. Close to the T and Harvard Square.
Located in quiet building in Porter Square. Walking distance to Harvard, Davis, Inman and Union Square .
Numerous restaurants, cafes, bars, grocery and specialty stores closeby.
Good for couple or small family.
Stictly no parties.
Accessibility: Ground floor but 8 steps up from street level. Not wheelchair friendly.
neighborhood_overview: Porter Square is a quiet and safe neigborhood on the outskirts of Harvard. You can walk to most amenities you would need (supermarkets, restaurants, cinema, pharmacy, public transportaion). It's a short T ride into Boston.

name: Sunny 3 Bdr corner luxury apartment
description: This sunny corner apartment in a modern building houses 6 comfortably. Two rooms have queen murphy bed/sofas,  and the last a twin daybed and trundle bed.   A short walk from Central Square, MIT and Harvard.    Enjoy gourmet kitchen and dining area.
neighborhood_overview: Beside being close to MIT and Harvard along with Central, Kendall and Inman Squares, our building is next to nationally-acclaimed restaurants Bondir (right next door) and Oleana (a block away).   A new coffee shop/craft beer shop (Lamplighter) just opened across the street.
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

name: Lux 2BR Cambridge Apt by MIT
description: Our apartment is located in Watermark Kendall West, one of the most exciting places to live, work, shop & play in the Boston area. At this community, there is an array of amenities such as a mezzanine terrace with a garden, fitness center and more.
neighborhood_overview: Live in the most exciting and vibrant neighborhood of Massachusetts. Kendall Square is a brimming area with cutting edge technology, science, design, innovation, creative restaurants, and fist-class shopping and is only a couple of metro stations away from downtown Boston. Take a few steps down the street and wander around the renowned Massachusetts Institute of Technology campus. Continue the knowledge tour at the Harvard University campus, where you’ll find peace and relax in its beautiful gardens and historic buildings. Unwind at the Charles River banks and enjoy the fantastic Boston views, where many trails and bike paths offer a haven to enjoy nature and a healthy lifestyle. Just across the Charles River you will be in downtown Boston surrounded by its gorgeous Revolution-era architecture and historic landmarks. The apartment is located in a modern high-rise boasting spectacular views and world-class resident amenities including a fitness center, a Zen garden, a clubhouse, and ful
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: 5BR Home in Cambridge
description:
Great home for families our large groups with off street parking and easy access to public transit.

Dogs allowed for an additional $50 per day fee (2 dogs max). Please mention in your request if you are bringing a dog. No cats due to allergies.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a quieter section of Cambridge.  Fresh Pond Reservation across the street has a 2 mile path for walking or jogging and many wooded areas to explore.  There are several great playgrounds within a short walk, and an assortment of small shops less than half a mile away in Huron Village, including a toy store, a grocery store, and a couple restaurants.  We live 1.5 miles from Harvard Square.  It is a very nice walk there, a 10 minute bus trip, or a $6-8 Uber ride.  Note that we do live on a busy road and traffic noise can be heard inside the house.  When windows are closed, it is barely noticeable.
host_about: We love to travel internationally with our four children and make our home available to other travelers while we are away.

name: Harvard & MIT- Sweet Retreat in Coolest Cambridge!
description:
Our Sweet Retreat is quietly hidden away in the heart of Cambridge, steps from a cafe, bike sharing, MBTA, Harvard, MIT, shops, and eateries — as well as equidistant to Harvard, Inman, and Central Squares. The apartment is comfortably furnished and INCLUDES off street PARKING!

We will greet you and point you to the historical, artsy, free, outdoors, music, restaurants, beaches, and etc. As friendly, long time Cambridge residents (designers and world travelers!), we know the hidden gems too.
neighborhood_overview: This is an old neighborhood of owner occupied homes once used as servants' quarters for the Brattle Street mansions near Harvard Square in the old, Victorian days. We neighbors all know each other, so things run smoothly. It is safe, quiet, friendly, and has GREAT coffee steps away.
host_about: Artist, textile/accessories designer, and global traveler with a particular love for Asian markets, vintage textiles, and artisans !! My daughter and I lived in Vietnam for the better part of 7 years, and our home is definitely a mini gallery of our travels. I am positive you will feel very happy to be in the midst of lovely colors, interesting books, and, best of all, in a seemingly quiet corner of Cambridge, tucked away, that in actuality — is in the center of all!

name: Private Apartment. Dog friendly. Parking
description: Take advantage our private, cozy Cambridge home. It is minutes from Harvard Sq. and Boston. Its close proximity to Fresh Pond is a bonus. Our friendly, Strawberry Hill neighborhood offers easy parking, great local eateries or a quiet night in. Dog friendly!
neighborhood_overview: Strawberry Hill is a very friendly neighborhood between Huron Ave and Mount Auburn Street. There are numerous little places by local owners offering a multitude of food within a ten minute walk.  All along Belmont Street one can find - Sofra ( a spinoff from Oleana) is a quick walk away; Eastern Lemejun has delicous Armenian & middle eastern offerings; Conleys Pub and sports bar is always serving up food and drinks; Homemade Greek yogurts and foods can be found at Sophia's on Belmont St, and just before that Linda's Donuts makes the best home made donuts from scratch every morning; Fiorellas has pizza and Italian; At Aram's Cafe, one can get a breakfast or lunch cooked by Aram himself, whose establishment has been cooking up delicious entrees for over 30 years; Moozies Ice cream for homemade ice cream and an outdoor movie screen in warm weather. There is a large supermarket, liquor store and drug store in Star Market as well as local food shops. The Fresh Pond Golf Course and Waterwork
host_about: I am an artist, cook, gardener, mom and teacher. I love to bike around FreshPond, kayak on the Charles River, watch my children's sports games, head to Rhode Island (my hometown ) for the beach. I love the city and all it has to offer.

name: Cambridge Modern Living
description: This cozy modern apartment is conveniently located a 5 minute car ride or 8 minute bus ride from Harvard Square, on a quiet residential street. The apartment is one block away from the 71 and 73 bus lines that run straight to Harvard Square. There is a couch or air mattress and shared bath available for you in this quaint 1 bedroom, 1 bath modern apartment.
neighborhood_overview:
Here are a few of my favorite things about my location:
1) Restaurants/Cafes/Bars less than 0.25 miles away include: Sofra, Red Lentil, Greg's, Cha Yen Thai Cookery, Deluxe Town Diner, Seta's Cafe, The Village Kitchen.
2) I love walking around and enjoying the beautiful homes, gardens and parks in the neighborhood.
3) Proximity to Harvard Square - you really can't beat it. You can be at the heart of Harvard Square in less than 5 minutes by bus or car.
4) Great live music - There are a number of live music venues nearby.
5) The Cambridge Public Library and newly renovated Harvard Art Museums are beautiful spaces with great architectural design and are within a walking distance from my place and they both are great places to spend the day.
6) Fresh Pond and Mt. Auburn Cemetery, two highlights, are within a 10 min walk.
host_about:
I'm a Designer/Education Entrepreneur. My company is based in Boston, but I'm a native Californian. I grew up in Southern California and got transplanted to the chilly East Coast. Let's just say, I'm still getting used to the winters!

I've been living in Cambridge for the past 6 years, and have come to enjoy the intellectual environment and diversity of the city.

I love art, electronic music, traveling, trying new restaurants, watching indie movies, and working on interactive art projects in my spare time.

name: Garden-level one-bedroom apartment
description:
Sun-filled 650 sq ft apartment in urban oasis. Private entrance. Minutes from Davis Sq and Alewife Red Line T-stops. Free street parking with guest permit. Fridge, microwave, coffee maker. Full bath. Check-in starts at 3 PM; check-out by 11 AM.

Access to the property is limited to registered guests. This spot is not suitable for entertaining, and third-party guests or visitors are not allowed.

Please read the entire listing & amenities pages and ask questions before booking.
host_about:
I started teaching at MIT seven years ago and fell in love with Cambridge. My favorite things about the neighborhood are its outstanding restaurants (José's Mexican Restaurant, Gran Gusto, True Bistro and Hana Sushi are all phenomenal and within walking distance), down-the-street access to the legendary Minuteman Bikeway (if you happen to enjoy a morning walk, run or bike ride; there are 2 Hubway bike-share stations near the house), and its quiet, almost suburban atmosphere.

I love to make guests feel welcome and comfortable and to share the joys of Cambridge living.

Sunny and spacious with two bedrooms and a separate food preparation/living and dining area.
neighborhood_overview: The area between Harvard and Porter Squares is one of the most lively and interesting parts of Cambridge, as is Davis Square which is also nearby. Temple Bar, Giulia, and numerous other great restaurants, takeout places and cafes are right around the corner. Abodeon, Pod, Nomad, and Joie de Vie plus the unusual vintage stores and music venues of Davis square are just a few of the interesting possibilities. The Peabody Museum with its exquisite glass flowers and the newly renovated Harvard Art Museums are within walking distance.

neighborhood_overview:
Easy walking distance to both Kendall and Inman squares. Close to lots shops, restaurants, and public transport (green line Lechmere and red line Kendall Square stops). 5 min walk to a large grocery store (Star Market).

Inman Sq and East Cambridge are vibrant, multicultural communities. You're only steps away from delicious Portuguese and Italian restaurants, Atwood's Tavern (great burgers with live music on the patio), Lone Star Taco Bar (fresh take on Mexican), Puritan & Company (modern New England), and Christina's (a classic Cambridge ice cream parlor)

name: Sunny Huron Village Apt. w/ Terrace
description: Our two-family home in West Cambridge includes a new one bedroom apartment on first floor, with sunny bedroom, living room, new kitchen & bath, as well as a wonderful private garden terrace.  Easy commute to Harvard Sq on foot or by bus.  Excellent WiFi for working remotely.
neighborhood_overview: West Cambridge is a hot neighborhood at the moment, with great urban amenities and excellent green spaces. Nestled between the historic homes of Brattle St, the unique shops of Huron Village and the green spaces of Fresh Pond reservoir and Danehy Park, there's lots to do and see. Jog or walk the 2 mile loop around the Pond, explore historic neighborhoods and sample the many interesting food shops. Or wander down to Harvard Square and all the university has to offer with museums and bookstores galore. Major retailers like Whole Foods and Starbucks are also a short walk away.
host_about:
I have lived in Cambridge for over 25 years.  I moved here for graduate school at Harvard and never left.  Currently, I'm a baker and  pastry chef  ( Instagram:  @hazelnama ) working part time in local bakeries.   However, my primary job is raising our eleven year old son.

I love to travel and have been all over world (most of that before having a child).  My partner and I spend a good deal of time in Maine but are plotting trips much further out as our son gets a little older.  

As a host I'm very accessible but mostly hands off.  I'm more than happy to answer any questions, point you in the direction of great restaurants or sights but tend to let our guests enjoy the space as they like.

name: Charming Harvard/MIT Gem - Free Parking & T Stop!
description: Welcome to our charming Harvard/MIT Victorian gem! Enjoy rare free off-street parking and easy access to the Boston T stop and blue bikes right next to our home. Recently remodeled, our home boasts classic charm, modern amenities, and a luxurious handmade copper Japanese soaking tub with rainfall shower. Perfect for 4-5 adults (+ kids). Book your unforgettable stay now!
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled up to Harvard and surrounds the neighborhood is quiet, well established, and beautiful with a lot of history and many famous residents past and current.

Located in the neighborhood of Cambridge called Huron Village, the home is blocks away from the historic Longfellow house, Harvard, MIT, Radcliffe, Leslie and the entire area exudes Victorian charm.

There is easy and quick access to local stores, tree lines streets, and it offers exceptionally easy access to all things Cambridge and Boston, no car required!
host_about:
I love anything with a story behind it.  I really enjoy any sort of cultural event and great conversation.

In Phoenix, we have tried to provide the perfect sanctuary to get away and yet still see everything the city has to offer for events, shopping, dining, and natural beauty.  North Scottsdale near Kierland is absolutely the perfect location to be.

In Cambridge/Boston we are working with a 124-year-old Victorian.    It's beautiful with a lot of New England charm.   Many homes of the type in the area are gut remodeled and turned into condos or modern style living spaces.  We are working hard to maintain its hand-built Victorian charm while greening its infrastructure where possible and protecting it for future generations.   It's literally an antique we feel more like stewards than owners of.

We are now sharing these homes with others and using any money we earn to further the renovation projects.   We hope to meet people that will continue with us on this journey and get to enjoy things each time they come back as we further improve the spaces for all to enjoy.

- Typically more cost-effective than booking two hotel rooms

- Savings of $35/night with an included parking space

- Authentic city-living experience in a residential neighborhood

Your considerations of 17 Traymore are valued. However, please note this apartment may not suit if you intend to host guests. Review house rules before booking.

name: Big 2 bedroom, steps to Davis Sq
description:
Spacious, sunny 2 bedroom, 6 room 1st floor of two-family, private entrance.
7-minute walk to Davis Sq & T-station, 1 min to Mass Ave bus. Queen and twin bed, Ful furnshd din rm, livrm, kit, washer/dryer.
Grt Location! (no pets) 4 month minimum stay!
neighborhood_overview:
North Cambridge ( NoCa) is a wonderful quiet neighborhood, and Hollis is one of the nicest streets in NoCa! It is a one way street, and traffic on the street is pretty light. Massachusetts ave is just abut 100 yards up, and within a 5 minute walk you will find many fine restaurants ( two sushi, one Greek, one Italian, one Vietnamese- French, one steak house, one Chinese), a produce market, a dry cleaner, and three banks. There is a CVS in Porter square, about a 10 minute walk on Mass Avenue, and the MINUTE CLINIC there is open 8am- 7 pm.
Additionally, at the end of Rindge Avenue end of Hollis, you will find branch of the Cambridge Public Library, and great play ground with both toddler and "big kid" sections, ball fields, and tennis courts.
And if you are looking for more night life, Davis Square, with a huge variety of restaurants, bars, gift shops, and hipsters, is about a 7 minute walk.

Cambridge is rich in history and bustling with activity, full of beautiful examples of old colonial architecture and a wonderful town to walk in. All of the following are within a 5 minute drive or an easy 20 minute stroll from the apartment.
East:
Harvard Square
Harvard University
American Repertory Theater
Cambridge Common
Tory Row

West:

Wholefoods

Apple Cinemas

The Charles River

Porter Square

Withing ten minutes of driving are MIT, Central Square, Kendall Square.

Hop across the river to get to Fenway Park, Newbury Street, the Museum of Fine Arts, and Boston's other attractions.

There is a binder in the apartment with information on great places to see and interesting things to do.

We live in Cambridge not far from the units and absolutely love the neighborhood. We would love to host you in this very cosy space, tastely decorated and furnished condo that used to call our primary home.

host_about: I am a Middle Grade/Young Adult writer (High) and editor, and I teach at Harvard Summer School and Harvard Extension School. name: Smack dab between Harvard+Porter 2
description:
The room has a double bed and is on the third floor, cozy and quiet, among the tree tops. At night you have the stars, and by day the room is light and sunny.

The room has wide, old pine board flooring, a sky light with a room-darkening shade, mini-split, closet, dresser, large desk with office supplies, yoga mat, full length mirror, and a fan.

This bedroom shares a full bathroom with the other third floor bedroom which is also rented through Airbnb.
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is very special in that it is quiet, you can hear birdsong most times of the day, there are lovely gardens all around. And you will be just 3 blocks from Massachusetts Avenue (Mass Ave), the busiest street in Boston/Cambridge. Or, if you are here in winter, the quiet of the cold air is lovely too, and if we are lucky, you'll see snow!

Along Mass Ave, you can walk to many local run businesses of every sort: gift shops (Joie de Vivre, Nomad, Abodeon, Tokai), coffee shops (Simons, Hi-Rise, Starbucks) and so many restaurants of every ethnicity (Indian, Japanese, Thai, Italian, Mexican, American). You can take a walk from here to the Charles River, through Harvard Square. You can stroll down Mass Ave to Central Square where there is a whole new world waiting for you, but just as Cambridge as any other place! Somerville is just minutes away too (Davis Square, Inman Square, Union Square), and it is an amazingly rich community for music, food and funky shops
host_about:
Hello!  

I've lived in Cambridge for 38 years.  I am an artist;  I paint, draw and sculpt.   I am a rather quiet person, with a good sense of humor.   I live with two cats, Aiko and Minkah.  They are friendly and enjoy guests. 

I love living in Cambridge.  It's a rather small town with so much to offer.  Boston is also very close by, accessible by the subway, bus or Uber.  There's so much to see and do there as well!    

This is a wonderful neighborhood and I really love sharing it with people.  It is good to remember the ocean is also near by and it is accessible by subway, rail or bus.  There are countless historical sites, museums, restaurants and shopping experiences in the area.  

I hope you will consider visiting Cambridge and staying at Smack Dab!

Just across the Charles River you will be in downtown Boston surrounded by its gorgeous Revolution-era architecture and historic landmarks. name: Cambridge Single Family -- Families and Pets!
description: Rare single family in Cambridge, MA only rented twice a year!  Three levels of historic and chic living: 2700sf.  Family and dog friendly with stunning private, fenced, grassy and professionally landscaped backyard.  6 min walk to T public trans (10 min T or 5-10 min Uber to Harvard; 25m T to downtown Boston). Walk to restaurants of vibrant Porter and Davis Squares or lovely parks.  Quiet, low-traffic street in safe and friendly neighborhood.  Private driveway. "Green" features.  Beyond compare!
neighborhood_overview: The North Cambridge neighborhood is the hidden gem of Cambridge.  Super-convenient "T" access.  Sports fields, playgrounds and multiple dog parks right around the corner.  Bike trail is about 5 minutes away.  Beautiful Fresh Pond and Danehy Park are very close by.  Many restaurants are within a short walk -- including two of greater Boston's highest rated restaurants (Table at Season to Taste and Urban Hearth).  Great casual restaurants in walking distance too--coffee shop, Mexican, Greek and others.  And then within a 15-20m walk are Davis and Porter Squares, with countless restaurants and bars.  Harvard Square is just slightly further (8 min Uber)  Above all, neighborhood is safe and family-friendly -- really nothing left to be desired!

neighborhood_overview: A stone's throw away, yet hidden from the bustle of Fresh Pond Parkway, this apartment is within walking distance of shops and restaurants, including Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Chipotle, TJ Maxx, and a movie theater. host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

name: Beautiful oasis on Cambridge border
description: Lovely, large,  2 bedroom, 2 bath home with stunning modern addition, 10 minutes from Harvard Square by car or bus, comes with an adorable cat for your playing pleasure.  Calm atmosphere with comfortable living room, TV room, fenced-in backyard.
neighborhood_overview: I live on a rotary on large boulevard across from Cambridge.  Harvard Square is 2.6 miles from the house, (~10 minutes by car, 15 by bus) and the bus stop is steps away. You can also easily take public transportation from Harvard Square or Belmont Center or drive to downtown Boston (about 20 minutes).  Fall is an ideal time to visit New England and you will be 15 to 20 minutes away from Walden Pond in Lincoln and the many historical sights in Concord.  (Bring your bikes for some excellent riding either straight from the house or in Concord/Lincoln.)  Numerous beaches, apple-picking and mountain-climbing are about an hour away.  Belmont also has a number of nature preserves should you wish to take some local hikes.  Fresh Pond, a local wooded reservoir, is a favorite exercise spot with a 3 mile loop from the house.  Next to Fresh Pond (a 10 minute walk) is a 9-hole golf course.  There are several excellent restaurants within walking distance.  Guests will be provided with a guidebook, i
host_about: I am a vivacious, retired lawyer passionate about gardening, travel, social justice and exercise (hiking, biking, kayaking and yes, the gym).  I share my house with an adorable, cuddly cat named Caleb. Manhattan born and bred, I have striven to make my home a country-like oasis in a suburban environment. As a host, I seek to provide my guests with a comfortable, calm, luxurious base from which to work/play.

name: Lovely room: walk to  Harvard Square with parking
description: It's a short walk to Central and Harvard Square. The room is lovely and quiet with high ceilings, two windows, wood floors, and a comfortable queen sized bed. There is a bureau, two chairs, and mirrors. The full bath is shared with myself and my daughter. There is a closet with hangers for your clothing and two of the bureau drawers are empty and available for you. There is an electric kettle, tea and water in your room as well as a few snacks. Your towels are in a basket in your closet.
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood has a tantalizing group of eclectic restaurants of all kinds and many places to have coffee. I have a guest book with menus and maps. The famous Plough and Stars pub is on the corner of Mass Ave and Hancock and they have live music most evenings. Improv Boston is just a few blocks away in Central Square. You can take the train downtown to Park Street to find the nearest theater, or go the Kendall Cinema in Kendall Square.
We are within walking distance of the beautiful recently renovated Harvard Art Museum as well as the Peabody Natural History Museum. If you love bookstores the Harvard Bookstore on Mass Ave is a treat as well as the tiny Grolier Bookstore which has only poetry, a Cambridge classic.
The Lizard Lounge just outside of Harvard Square is well known for its poetry slams on Sunday nights. Passim in Harvard Square is another local favorite if you want to hear folk music. The ART theater has two locations, one in Harvard Square for their main theatr
host_about: I am an actress and improv performer, teacher, writer, mother and dog lover. I love yoga and improv and  I am a vegetarian. I spqeak French relatively fluently and I love to travel. I practice meditation qqand I believe in the connectedness of all living beings.

name: Sunny, spacious 2BR w/roof deck near Harvard and T
description: Steps away from public transport in a lovely historic neighborhood!  This guest suite is on the 3rd floor of our elegant home in Porter Square. neighborhood_overview:

neighborhood_overview: Live in the most exciting and vibrant neighborhood of Massachusetts. Kendall Square is a brimming area with cutting edge technology, science, design, innovation, creative restaurants, and fist-class shopping and is only a couple of metro stations away from downtown Boston. Take a few steps down the street and wander around the renowned Massachusetts Institute of Technology campus. Continue the knowledge tour at the Harvard University campus, where you’ll find peace and relax in its beautiful gardens and historic buildings. Unwind at the Charles River banks and enjoy the fantastic Boston views, where many trails and bike paths offer a haven to enjoy nature and a healthy lifestyle. Just across the Charles River you will be in downtown Boston surrounded by its gorgeous Revolution-era architecture and historic landmarks.
