name: 3BR/3BA | 3 Parking | by Central Sq, Harvard & MIT
description:
Step into the comfort of this delightful 3BR/3Bath condo in the very heart of Cambridge. A spacious & relaxing retreat in a prime location just a few mins from Harvard, MIT, Boston Downtown and walkable to many restaurants, bars, cafes, shops and attractions.

✔ 3 Comfortable Bedrooms each with own private bathroom
✔ Fully Equipped Kitchen
✔ Smart TVs
✔ Workspaces
✔ High-Speed Wi-Fi (500 mbps)
✔ Washer/Dryer
✔ 3x Parking Spots

All amenities are provided for your comfort.

See more below!
neighborhood_overview:
The condo is nestled in a safe and friendly neighborhood in the heart of Cambridge, MA. This prime and well-connected location, with a Walk Score of 98, offers everything you need within walking distance.

One of the main draws of Cambridge is its world-renowned universities, including Harvard University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). Take a guided tour of these campuses to learn about their history, see their beautiful architecture, or explore independently.

Beyond the universities, Cambridge has several excellent museums and cultural institutions. For example, the Harvard Museum of Natural History features exhibits on everything from dinosaurs to gemstones, while the MIT Museum showcases the latest advances in science and technology. The Harvard Art Museums are a must-visit for art lovers, with collections ranging from ancient Greek pottery to contemporary paintings.

In addition to its academic and cultural offerings, Cambridge is
host_about:
Hello there and thank you for visiting my host profile!

I am a Real Estate professional living and working in Cambridge and have been an active host since 2010. 

I am passionate about traveling and love to meet new people of all cultures and backgrounds. I’m originally from Taiwan and enjoy playing music.

Feel free to book or message me first; I am more than happy to answer any specific questions you may have!

name: 3Bdr with parking in West Cambridge
description: Take a walk around Fresh Pond Reservoir, exercise in Danehy Park, shop at Whole Foods and Trader Joe's. A mile and a half from Harvard with a private parking place, this apartment is a perfect base for your short term visit.
neighborhood_overview: A stone's throw away, yet hidden from the bustle of Fresh Pond Parkway, this apartment is within walking distance of shops and restaurants, including Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Chipotle, TJ Maxx, and a movie theater. host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

name: Big, Bright, Private Room w Bath in luxury condo
description:
This really is an amazing place! The condo is beautiful and has a fully stocked kitchen, dining and living room. You'll have a spacious sunny bedroom w/tv and your own private full bath. Add-ons: free gym, use of w/d & office equipment.

I'd love to have you stay in my home. I live here with 2 fabulous, friendly cats who love guests. Please do not book this room if you don't like cats, are afraid of them, or are allergic to them. I look forward to meeting you! Ciao!!!
neighborhood_overview: This is a beautiful location in Cambridge. You’re just a few steps away from the scenic Charles River and its running and bike paths.  There’s a Whole Foods, a Trader Joe’s, a drugstore, 3 restaurants and a Microcenter (computer and office supplies) on this block, and Sculler’s Jazz Club is right across the river, a 10 minute walk in heels... and did I mention that the best lobster sandwich in Boston is just a block away.
host_about:
I’m an award- winning designer, singer and cook.  And, I'm open to people of all stripes... or polka dots, or color, or gender, or sexual preference. 
I'm a Jersey girl who came to Cambridge as a grad student and never left...  so I can help with local history, lore and information, dining and entertainment suggestions... and if I don’t know something, I know someone who does... and I can guide you to the best lobster sandwich in Boston, just a block away, courtesy of my friends Louie and Mario... and I love meeting new people, like you!

name: Spacious Strawberry Hill Suite (West Cambridge)
description:
This 3rd floor suite is less than 2 miles west of Harvard Sq. You'll have exclusive access to the space, which has a full bathroom and kitchenette.

There is a queen bed suitable for two people and the couch in the living room converts to a bed for one.

Our neighborhood is friendly, safe, and has a lot to offer. Public transportation (bus) is a 5 minute walk. The trip to Harvard Square is 10-15 minutes.

I live in the home downstairs and am available should you need me during your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in Strawberry Hill, the smallest neighborhood in Cambridge, and very close to the borders of Watertown and Belmont, Mass. The house is approximately 2 miles west of Harvard Sq., which is easy to get to via public transportation. We’re also near Fresh Pond (about a 10-minute walk) which has lovely trails for walking, running, biking and more.

This listing faces a cemetery, which is very common in this area but worth noting. The cemeteries in this area are well maintained parks. specifically Mount Auburn Cemetery which offers tours.
host_about:
Welcome to my childhood home!

My favorite thing to do on weekends is try new restaurants in Boston and Cambridge. Let me know if you want suggestions!

I try to go to as many live shows as I can. My favorite venues are: Roadrunner and the Sinclair.

Favorite travel destinations: Stockholm; Erfurt, Germany; Mauritius; Porto, Portugal.

Currently binge-ing on: RuPaul's Drag Rae and any show where they restore an old house.

neighborhood_overview:
We are in the heart of diverse Inman Square, Cambridge, Massachusetts. The neighborhood is wonderful, safe and has great energy, not to mention great night life and everything you need! There are many eateries, entertainment venues and sites to visit via walking or taking public transportation. The MBTA bus system is located just outside the door. Also, Uber, Zip Car, Lyft and Hubway Bike rentals are all accessible in Inman Square.
Boston's oldest, continuously operating improvisational theater troupe, ImprovBoston is located just around the corner on Prospect Street in nearby Central Square. ImprovBoston alumni include Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me! panelist Adam Felber.
Studio200 is in a convenient location with lots to see and do with its' many world class museums, colleges and restaurants. Visit Boston's little Italy, Chinatown or the theatre district where you can take in a movie or live play at the famous Wang Centre. See the Blue Man Group.

1400 sf 3.5-bedroom condo two blocks from Harvard Yard. The entire top floor of a three-story house so you get light from all four sides. Seven minutes from the Harvard Square Red Line T station. Perfect set-up for a couple with kids. The downstairs unit, exactly half the size, sold in June 2017 for over $800k.

Well-behaved dogs welcome.

name: private studio near Harvard/MIT
description: My place has everything you need for a comfortable, easy stay in Cambridge: a  keyless entry to a completely separate studio space allows you to arrive anytime after 3,  so no worries if you arrive on the late side. You''ll find a queen sized bed, microwave/fridge/coffeemaker,  streaming TV, comfortable recliner and a desk chair for when you're working.  We're walking distance from Kendal, Central, and Harvard Squares.  On street parking in our neighborhood using our visitor pass, upon request.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood has a mix of younger professionals, families, and students. We're right next to a city park, 5 minutes from Central Square, and walking distance from Harvard Square and Kendal Square. Central Square has a big collection of restaurants, from alternative vegetarian to Indian, Chinese, the best sushi restaurant in Cambridge, and many more.
host_about: When I travel, I want to feel comfortable and at home wherever I'm visiting, as much like I"m living there as possible.  That's what we've created here: a comfortable little home smack in the middle of Cambridge, 5 minutes from the MBTA subway system, and a lovely walk to Harvard in one direction and MIT/Kendal Square in the other.

name: 1 Bedroom in Kendall Square
description:
This is a great place that is close to everything. It is on the top floor of a three unit building in which you can see the edges of the Boston skyline in the distance.

This place has a comfortable bed, couch, and fully functional Roku TV.

You can get to the Kendall Square T stop within a 10 minute walk and there is plenty to eat and shop for at the Cambridgeside Galleria which is only 3 blocks away.
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is the real value of this unit. It is close to the Red line and Green line, both of which will get you anywhere you want to go in Boston or Cambridge within just 15 minutes on the train. And each of these lines is only a 10 minute walk away.

Also, you'll have access to a large mall with plenty of shopping and food options available for you at the Cambridgeside Galleria.

name: Harvard, MIT & RedLine to Boston!
description:
We're proud to be Superhosts again! Thanks to our amazing guests for your support.

Being loved by our guests is truly heartwarming, and we eagerly anticipate hosting even more amazing guests in the future. As a humble request, we kindly ask that you reach out to us before making a booking. We value the opportunity to get to know all our guests beforehand, as it help ensure that our home is a perfect fit for both host and guest.

We look forward to welcoming you to our home with open arms!
neighborhood_overview:
Right across from the Harvard Law School and from the corner of Longy School of Music, 4 minute walk to Harvard Square, this is truly a vibrant neighborhood yet residential. You are close to everything you need to. We have cafe's (Starbucks and hi-rise), the famous falafel store- wrappro, Cambridge commons.

Harvard Square Redline is 5 to 6 minutes walk or less.
host_about: A Boston based working professional who loves hosting. I love easy going friendly people. Hope to host you.

name: Cambridge Comfort - pet friendly, yard and parking
description:
Update: Seeking short term, but with longer term ideal.

My place is a warm, spacious condo with 10 ft high ceilings and mostly hardwood floors throughout. Eat in kitchen with full laundry, dining room/study, and living room. 1.5 bathrooms. Near shopping and entertainment, and public transportation. Free off-street parking, rear deck and yard, and front porch. The room is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. It is also possible to bring a pet (message me if interested).
neighborhood_overview:
My place is in North Cambridge and more residential. It's along the border with Somerville and close to Arlington. Century(s) old classic "Double/Triple Deckers" are common and young or youngish professionals, students and young families live in the mostly renovated homes.

Though quiet, its location is very close free live music nightly in Davis or Porter squares, and probably over 50 restaurants within walking distance.
host_about:
I'm new to Airbnb and wondering why I haven't hosted at my place before.  My work is in health care both clinical and in research regulation.  For fun I bike, hike, climb, play soccer, and take excursions both near and far when the opportunity arises.   
Favorite places are Seattle where I lived years, and Central and South America where I work/volunteer when possible.  Nearby, Davis Square,sailing in Boston Harbor, or road trips in New England top the list.  
I've mainly been a solo traveler and have skipped across the world at a rapid pace from hostel to hostel, now I'm looking for more focused trips and Airbnb seems to be the best answer for this.  
I have my first guest currently, and I look forward to many more in the future, and from all over the world.  
My dog is extremely friendly, quiet and would love the company as well.  We will consider travelers with pets.  
Happy traveling!

name: Harvard/MIT (Unit 1)- Brooklyn Ambiance w/ Parking
description: Central Square is known for its diversity, upscale, ethnic eateries and a vibrant club scene.  Easy walk to Central Square subway (3 min), MIT (12 min) and Harvard (15).   Our apartment offers parking for 1 large car, and a well-equipped kitchen for entertaining.
neighborhood_overview: Central Sq. is hot!  Lots of great dining options.  Walking to either MIT or Harvard is very easy.  Cambridge is a bike friendly city.
host_about: I am an English teacher for new Americans own the two unit apartment building.    If unable to personally greet you, our two sons will be happy to assist you.  We live two miles away from this building.   We have developed an "insider's guide to Cambridge" to provide you with a solid foundation to enjoy your stay.  We frequently stay with Airbnb hosts when we travel.    I am member of two choirs and love history and literature.

name: Spacious 2BR 2 bath, walk to Harvard & MIT
description: Welcome! This home is spacious and airy, with high ceilings and open floor plan.  Charming, historic house with all modern amenities: central A/C, stainless steel appliances, Wi-fi, and washer/dryer in unit. Complimentary coffee & tea. Quiet, residential street, yet close to everything: 10 min walk to Harvard,  20-30 min walk to MIT, bus or T (subway) to Boston (25 min). WholeFoods, restaurants, and shops around the corner, with lots more within 5-15 mins walk. Parking by arrangement.
neighborhood_overview: We're on a  tree-lined, quiet, residential street with brick sidewalks and charming 100-year old wood houses, but walking distance to everything. Around the corner are several restaurants and cafés: Dali's (tapas), Kebob factory (Indian), Bergamot (American / fusion), The Thirsty Scholar Pub, Darwin's (sandwiches and baked goods - yum!) and the Biscuit (bakery and café). If you want to eat in,  get stuff around the corner at Wholefoods, The Wine and Cheese Cask, and Savenor's the butcher. A short walk away are lots more shops, restaurants and night life in Inman Square (5min), Harvard Square (10-15 min) and Union Square (5-10min). Harvard Art Museums 10 min, public library and pool 3-5 min walk.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Kjersti, (yup, unusual name unless you're Norwegian - so I also answer to Kirsti or just K:).  I love to travel to places a bit off the beaten path. Closer to home I enjoy my kids, skiing, hiking, biking, Kung Fu, cooking, and spending time with  family and friends.  Looking forward to hearing from you! 
Best, 
Kjersti

name: Harvard Square - spacious, free on street parking
description:
WE NOW HAVE VERY FAST INTERNET SERVICE!
Located in Harvard Square, minutes away from the HARVARD ,HARVARD LAW, and HARVARD BUSINESS SCHOOL The two bedroom home has two large living rooms with books and original art. An easy walk to reach two excellent cafe's or visit the Harvard Art Museum to see a Van Gogh or Cezanne or have a fabulous meal. *Also, this apartment is not owned by an investment firm or controlled by a property management company.
neighborhood_overview: Mount Auburn Street is a tree lined street with an eclectic array of local gardens lining the sidewalk.  The neighborhood is part of the Half Crown Marsh Conservation District with mostly Victorian architecture    The house is four doors away from Longfellow Park - designed by Charles Elliot in 1887.  Across the street is Riverbend Park where you can sit on a bench and watch the Charles River where rowing teams from the various universities often practice.  We have two cafes in the neighborhood. Darwins and Flour both very good and both close. Memorial Drive which runs alongside the Charles River ( a short block from our house) is closed for biking, roller skating etc. from 11am to 7pm on Sundays from the last Sunday in April until the 2nd Sunday in November.  Because of major universities located in Cambridge, the city is very international and you will hear many different languages spoken

name: Sunny 1 bedroom condo close to Harvard/MIT
description:
Quiet and cozy one bedroom condo close to Harvard, MIT, and Inman Square! Recently renovated in a historic Victorian building, it features an updated kitchen and bathrooms, in-unit washer/dryer, and all of the comforts of home. We hope you can use our place as a launching pad for exploring Boston and Cambridge!

There is not parking available as part of this listing.
neighborhood_overview: Inman Square is convenient to everything! Just a 10 minute walk to Central Square where there's lots of shopping and restaurants, plus easy access to the MBTA red line stop at Central Square. Just a block or two away from the apartment are tons of restaurants and coffee shops, making it easy to try all of the delicious cuisine in the area! We are also located in between two Whole Foods, and just two blocks away from a Walgreens. We love living here because it's so easy to get around. Central Square is a 10 minute walk, Harvard and MIT both take about 20-25 minutes to walk, or there are a number of bus lines running all over Boston just a block away!
host_about:
Hi! We are Steph and Ken. We love being active and trying new things. Some of our favorite things are the performing arts, working out, the beach, Disney trips, and meeting new people. Travel is awesome and I've been to Thailand, Laos, Vietnam, London, Paris, Berlin, Sydney, Bali and a few other fun places.

We are clean and respectful, and will treat your home like our own.

host_about: Friendly, politically progressive, resourceful... I love hosting people from all over the world, and know the area well for a native NY'er. Our place is relaxing and down to earth, with  an artistic and colorful ambiance, and lots of sunlight.

neighborhood_overview:
Riverside is a residential neighborhood located along the Charles River, which includes some of the oldest settled parts of Cambridge. Harvard Square and Central Square, both major commercial and transit centers, lie at either end of the neighborhood. Massachusetts Avenue, which connects the two squares, serves as the neighborhood’s retail. Smaller commercial areas exist along Putnam Avenue, Western Avenue and River Street.
Whole Foods (with wine and beer) is a 5-minute walk; the Charles River (with walking and biking paths) is a 3-minute walk.
This is a diverse and convenient neighborhood.

name: Casa Paradiso - Top Floor 1bed/1bath in Cambridge
description:
Welcome to my Cambridge home with the vibe of Havana! I'd love to share my sunny, professionally-designed 1 bed/1 bath with you. Please treat it with kind and respect, as I would for you and yours.

With a walking score of 93, we're in a bustling neighborhood of great restaurants, coffee shops, craft beer pubs, and supermarkets. You can access Boston from Lechmere (Green), or Harvard Sq via the 69 bus, or bike/walk to Kendall Sq and Central Sq (Red).
neighborhood_overview:
+Across the street is the public library, which I love to go and read or do work
+Right outside is a Little Free Library book exchange. It's an adorable place where you can take and leave books. Feel free to grab some or leave some!
+A few doors down is a bakery with the most amazing Portuguese bread I have ever tasted. I get some once a week.
+A few blocks down is a local butcher shop where I get fresh eggs and meats. If there are some in the fridge during your stay, you're more than welcome to them!
+There's a park and community pool across the street, which is fun in the summers to watch people play softball, or sit on the grass and read a book
+One of my favorite places to eat is Puritan & Company, which serves a modern twist to traditional New England cuisine
+If you're craving Tacos, there is a fab spot called the Lone Star Taco Bar. 4.5 stars, almost 900 reviews. Just saying.
+Usually known for their live music, or just a casual drink at a lo

name: Cambridge Executive Suites
description:
A modern, comfortable, sun-lit Executive Suite with all the necessary amenities for a business traveller.

The 550 sq. ft. suite includes a kitchen with appliances, utensils and supplies. A comfortable bedroom, with a charming view over Linear Park, bathroom and equipped work/lounge space.

The suite is well connected; just a 5 min. walk from the vibrant Davis Square. It's ideal for Guests visiting Tufts/Harvard/MIT for example. Any destination in metropolitan Boston can be reached in 25 mins.
neighborhood_overview:
The suite is located in North Cambridge, near the hip and vibrant Davis Square, Somerville, just a 5 min. walk away along Linear Park. Linear Park is a charming well lit pathway that is well trafficked day and night by folks day and night, walking back and forth to Davis Square, often with street music performers at points along the way.

Davis Square is certainly a cultural location, with shows and movies to see at the Somerville Theatre, in addition to Somerville Open Studios, ArtBeat, HONK! to name but a few of the many festivals the occur in the town around the year.

Davis Square is also a dining destination. There's something for everyone in these blocks, from barbecue to vegan fare. One can find the cuisines of Mexico, Italy, China, India, Japan, and more. And there are new places to find delicious food opening all the time.

And for nightlife, there are no shortage of bars, from the casual to the hip and trendy with fine beverages and food on offer
host_about:
I am part of a three person team. I have an two adorable children, Amber and Aiden.

I am the founder of a real estate tech company, and previously worked as a Structural Engineer on the design of skyscrapers.

I love to travel when I can, and have already visited many countries. But there are plenty of places left to explore, and enjoy again.

I am principally on airbnb to host. But who knows, on my next vacation I may also stay at someone's airbnb in an exotic location.

name: Lux 2 Bedroom Cambridge Apt by MIT
description: Our apartment is located in Watermark Kendall West, one of the most exciting places to live, work, shop & play in the Boston area. At this community, there is an array of amenities such as a mezzanine terrace with a garden, fitness center and more.
neighborhood_overview: Live in the most exciting and vibrant neighborhood of Massachusetts. Kendall Square is a brimming area with cutting edge technology, science, design, innovation, creative restaurants, and fist-class shopping and is only a couple of metro stations away from downtown Boston. Take a few steps down the street and wander around the renowned Massachusetts Institute of Technology campus. Continue the knowledge tour at the Harvard University campus, where you’ll find peace and relax in its beautiful gardens and historic buildings. Unwind at the Charles River banks and enjoy the fantastic Boston views, where many trails and bike paths offer a haven to enjoy nature and a healthy lifestyle. Just across the Charles River you will be in downtown Boston surrounded by its gorgeous Revolution-era architecture and historic landmarks. The apartment is located in a modern high-rise boasting spectacular views and world-class resident amenities including a fitness center, a Zen garden, a clubhouse, and ful
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

description: Our apartment is located in Watermark Kendall West, one of the most exciting places to live, work, shop & play in the Boston area. At this community, there is an array of amenities such as a mezzanine terrace with a garden, fitness center and more.
neighborhood_overview: Live in the most exciting and vibrant neighborhood of Massachusetts. Kendall Square is a brimming area with cutting edge technology, science, design, innovation, creative restaurants, and fist-class shopping and is only a couple of metro stations away from downtown Boston. Take a few steps down the street and wander around the renowned Massachusetts Institute of Technology campus. Continue the knowledge tour at the Harvard University campus, where you’ll find peace and relax in its beautiful gardens and historic buildings. Unwind at the Charles River banks and enjoy the fantastic Boston views, where many trails and bike paths offer a haven to enjoy nature and a healthy lifestyle. Just across the Charles River you will be in downtown Boston surrounded by its gorgeous Revolution-era architecture and historic landmarks. The apartment is located in a modern high-rise boasting spectacular views and world-class resident amenities including a fitness center, a Zen garden, a clubhouse, and ful
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more.

name: Serene, Roomy 2BR near Harvard & Davis Sq
description:
Enjoy the peaceful tree views from this tastefully furnished, sun-splashed apt in Cambridge! Located on a quiet cul-de-sac, this peaceful 2nd floor apt is a short walk from vibrant shopping centers Porter Sq and Davis Sq (1 subway stop from Harvard Sq). Driveway parking for 1-2 cars avail for extra $100/mo.

STAYS OF 30+ NIGHTS ONLY. NO TAXES FOR 32+ DAY STAYS
neighborhood_overview:
Porter Square area is a happening neighborhood with plenty of restaurants, bars, shops, and grocery stores. Our apartment is a short walk to the Porter Sq subway stop on the Red Line. Harvard Square can be reached in 10 minutes by train (1 stop), or 20 minutes by foot past the colorful shops of Massachusetts Ave. Stay on the train past Harvard and arrive in downtown Boston in 10 minutes or so. Enjoy the beautiful views of the Charles River along the way!

Nearby Porter Square offers a variety of shops including a supermarket, drug store, toy shop, a gift shop that sells wares made by local artists, and a well-visited independent book store (with great coffee!) that frequently hosts talks by notable authors. There's even a new Target a short walk away. Within 2 blocks of the house there are 2 fantastic, highly rated restaurants (Cuban, French), an eclectic neighborhood restaurant/bar, and right at the end of the street is a beloved sports bar that's been in the neighborhood fo
host_about: Hi, I'm Cheryl. I love dancing, playing violin, challenging myself, and trying new things with friends. (Boston is a great place for trying new things!) I meditate regularly and try to live every day according to my values.

name: 3Bdr Spacious Apartment near Fresh Pond
description: Take a walk around Fresh Pond Reservoir, exercise in Danehy Park, shop at Whole Foods and Trader Joe's. A mile and a half from Harvard with a private parking place, this apartment is a perfect base for your short or long term visit.
neighborhood_overview: A stone's throw away, yet hidden from the bustle of Fresh Pond Parkway, this apartment is within walking distance of shops and restaurants, including Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Chipotle, TJ Maxx, and a movie theater. Equally accessible to two of Cambridge's largest green spaces -- Fresh Pond Reservoir and Danehy Park. Close to public transportation (subway & bus) to take you anywhere around Cambridge and Boston. For the adventurous, ride along the Minuteman Bikeway from Alewife out to historic Lexington and Bedford.
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

name: BnB! Sunny private bedroom/bath near Harvard
description: A private bedroom and private bath in a BoHo style condo  located in Huron Village, a quiet, safe neighborhood in Cambridge.  A continental breakfast is included. Harvard University, Harvard Square and access to public transport (the T)  are only a  15 minute walk along beautiful historic Brattle Street. A diversity of nearby restaurants, cafes, museums, pubs, shops and music and art experiences abound.  Boston is an easy T ride away.
neighborhood_overview: If you are going to visit Cambridge or Boston, this is a great place to stay. Huron Village is a quiet neighborhood full of families, walkers, runners and bicyclists. Its safe to walk here both day and night.  You can stop for a great dinner in Harvard Square and then enjoy a leisurely walk back to Huron Village along historic Brattle street.
host_about: I am a retired science teacher and school administrator.  When I travel, I love to go on  walking holidays. Walking allows me to pay more attention to the landscape and the surrounding architecture, which I love the most.   My favorite walking holiday so far has been through Cornwall, England.  No matter where I go, I always try to seek out some good jazz - especially Latin jazz! The small local music venues are often the best.   I have always been  curious about people, who they are, where they are from and what are their life stories. I look forward to lots of interesting conversations as both a host and a guest.

name: Urban oasis in Huron Village
description: The best of all possible worlds! Bright and airy  cathedral-ceilinged two-bedroom unit  in leafy and lovely Huron Village, across the street from Fresh Pond Reservoir trails, Blue Bikes docking station, and great nine-hole golf course. Walk, bike, drive, bus, or T to Harvard Square.  Great bakeries  and food from cheap eats to high end  in easy walking distance.  Additional guests can be accommodated for a  $50/night charge. Mass. STR certificate C0107520491.
neighborhood_overview: Huron Village is the best of all possible worlds: leafy, lovely, and quiet, it has all the urban amenities.  Fresh Pond Reservoir's  2 1/2 mile walking/running trail is right across the street, with a Blue Bikes docking station.  Within a half mile radius are three bakeries, a Whole Foods and a Trader Joe's and a dozen specialty food stores, not to mention foods from around the world for eat-in or take-out.  Don't miss E.H. Chocolatier.  From spring to Autumn, Formaggio hosts a Saturday afternoon outdoor barbecue, with fried chicken, ribs, and all the fixings.

Stay here and be in town next to MIT and Harvard.

Whole 1 Bedroom apartment with new King size bed, 1 full bath, Leather sleeper sofa. New Kitchen, A/C, in-unit W/D, gas fireplace. On the edge of MIT's campus. In the heart of Central Square's Cultural District.

You will have access to whole apartment. No Parties, No Smoking, No Pets.

Welcome to Cambridge! We look forward to hosting you and your family and friends.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is a Cultural District that is home to diversity, and world renowned universities. There are lots of events in the arts, music, and science. It is the epicenter of the tech hub, walking distance to innovation sector, biotech, research, pharma labs.
host_about:

If this is your first time in Boston I’m happy to give you recommendations for things to see, eat, and do in this great city. Look forward to meeting you!
-Dan

name: Sunny 2Bed Apt—10 Meters from Harvard Law School!
description:
**Please send inquiry NOT a request**

Sunny, fully renovated 2bedroom apt 10 meters from Harvard Law School! High ceilings, tons of light, original art & high end furniture. Authentic Harvard experience.

-7 minute walk to Harvard Sq train
-24 hr keyless entry
-Quiet 1st floor apt in safe Harvard Sq neighborhood
-Perfect for exploring Harvard, MIT, Cambridge, Boston
-Large sunny office
-Great food, history & culture within 1 min walk
-Ideal for school visits, business or vacation
neighborhood_overview:
This is located at Harvard Square, a fantastic and historic area. There are dozens of great restaurants, shops, and history about 30 seconds from the door.

It's a cultural hub--you'll find tons of diverse food (Thai, Indian, Italian, Asian, Gastro, New American, Venezuelan!) and activities down the street. The Museum of Natural History is a 5 minute walk, and the renowned Harvard Art Museums are a 10 minute walk. Harvard Law School is literally 10 meters from the apartment.

The Red Line train is right in the center of Harvard Square. It's easy and inexpensive to take the train to any location in Boston or Cambridge.
host_about:
Cheerful world traveler and food fanatic--my brother and I started a family bakery in 2022.

Can't live without my passport and exotic fruit garden (50 trees!) I studied Swahili, Portuguese, Spanish & Latin. I adore street markets, thrifting and adventures. 

I love being a warm, friendly host! I give guests complete privacy, but I'm always available to help or give recommendations. I treat guests like fam and surprise them with treats :)

neighborhood_overview:
We are a recently retired couple from MIT. We live with our cat, Isis, in a vibrant urban neighborhood steps away from the T, cafes, shops, live theater and music, and Zagat-rated restaurants. Walk 10 minutes to MIT or 20 minutes to Harvard or take the T and be in either Harvard Square or Boston in 2 minutes.

Our home, our apartment and the garden have turned out to be delightful retreats in the middle of a bustling city environment.

name: Your own private bed, bath, and office/bonus room!
description:
Like Harvard Square's hipper little cousin, Davis Square is famous for its art festivals, restaurants, and live music performances.

This bright, private room is a perfect home base for visiting scholars, or for exploring the city. Located on a leafy side street lined with historic Victorian homes, a short 3-min walk will take you to Davis' lively center. From there, take the Red Line directly to Harvard, MIT, or Downtown Boston. Tufts is a short 20 min walk or 7 min bus ride away. Come explore!
host_about:
I love traveling and meeting new people. Some of my favorite destinations I've traveled to recently are Thailand, Switzerland, Italy, and France. Next up, Japan!

I've lived in Cambridge/Somerville for 10 years now-- first as a student, and now as a software engineer-- so if you have any questions about the area, just ask!

name: Beautiful room in Cambridge , Ma
description: Beautiful private room with a comfy queen bed... Shared bathroom  ( only if the other room is rented at the time if not its all yours)!  Great location- perfect for travel nurses, doctors, professionals.
neighborhood_overview:
Cambridge is a city in Massachusetts, across the Charles River from Boston! Its home to Harvard University. At the heart of campus, grassy Harvard Yard is anchored by the neoclassical Windner Library. Harvard Square has cafes, bars and book stores!
South East is the prestigious Massachusetts Institute of Technology ( MIT)
host_about:
Hello!

Thanks for checking out my properties!  

My name is Dawn and I have been living in beautiful historical Charlestown for the last 16 years. My property is near and dear to my heart as this was my grandparents home that I pretty much grew up in and that I bought after they passed away. I recently decided to turn my beautiful peice of property into a place where visitors can come and enjoy all this wonderful city has to offer while staying in a place of history vs a hotel!  You will enjoy staying here and all this city has to offer_ I will make sure of it!  :) 
 
Thank you and I look forward to meeting you!  

Dawn

name: Stunning & sunny; 3BR/2BA Harvard Sq
description: Live like a Cantabrigian in a "triple decker" (a building type unique to New England).  This top floor apartment has a convivial living room, dining/study, a renovated eat-in kitchen, 3 bedrooms, 2 renovated baths, in unit laundry and central air.  Nearby parking available for $250/mo. But no need for a car: we are steps from public transport, 3 blocks from Harvard Yard and in the cultural and culinary heart of Cambridge.  Lease rate is $7,000 month, 4 month minimum.
neighborhood_overview: We are in the eastern part of Harvard Square, which not only makes Harvard Square within a few minute's walk but Inman Square and Central Square are also close by.  A nice grocery is right across the park and Darwin's coffee shop and Harvard mini market are just a few steps away (with Harvard Market brewing a far superior coffee than Darwin's IMHO). Looking for a the best coffee or espresso in the city?  I have some opinions on that (though we provide a Keurig and pods). We also provide guests with a culinary key to the city, including where to go and what to order (both on and off the menu).
host_about: We live in Cambridge, MA with two small children and enjoy traveling to National Parks in the United States.

neighborhood_overview: East Cambridge is a vibrant community with many local restaurants, several art venues, a theater and places to explore. The gorgeous Charles river is two blocks from our house with the neighboring Cambridgeside mall. Kendall square is a short walk and Harvard Square is within a stone's throw.  If you would like more information or suggestions let us know and we'll offer some of the locals' best Cambridge places to explore. We want you to have the best possible time while you're here!

name: Blueground | Kendall Sq, gym, nr mit
description: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this cheery Kendall Square furnished studio apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and exquisite living room with great views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS42)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Pretty private garden-level condo+parking near MIT
description:
Walking distance of MIT/Central/Tech Square and a number of nice cafes and bars in the heart of Cambridge.
+ Recently finished modern apartment;
+ Self-checkin with a smartlock;
+ Private apartment exclusively yours;
+ Private off-street entrance;
+ On-street parking permit included;
+ Work- and laptop-friendly spaces;
+ Sparkling clean with new appliances and fixtures.
neighborhood_overview:
Walk friendly: Walking distance (12-20 mins) to MIT, Kendall square, and east and mid Cambridge. A longer walk (~1.4 mi) or short Uber/Lyft ride to Harvard.

Runner friendly: Warm up with a walk/run ~1 mile to get to the Charles river, and then run a loop taking one bridge across the river to Boston and another back to create a 3 mile or 4 mile loop (depending on the bridge), and then cool down another ~1 mile to get back home. Except the bridges, Cambridge/Boston is really flat, perfect for easy jogs.

Groceries: Multiple Whole Foods locations within ~0.6 to ~0.8 miles; Star Market ~0.6 miles away; H Mart ~0.9 miles away.
host_about: Scientist, traveler, coffee lover, fitness freak, host, and an optimist with perhaps an irrational faith in humanity.

name: Stunning urban hideaway nearby Harvard Square
description: Charming apartment in a 19th century Victorian house conserves its period architectural details in recently renovated comfort. Light streams into this en-suite guest residence through gracious windows. Beautiful cabinetry and bookcases offer some evening reading. Enjoy the marble bathroom and hardware floors and well-appointed kitchenette. A stone's throw from Porter Square, where bars, cafes, boutiques, and transportation options abound. Minutes to Harvard,  MIT and Boston.
neighborhood_overview:
Historic, posh Avon Hill neighborhood is great for walking. This part of Cambridge in general has an abundance of old Victorian homes over several square miles. The Cooper-Frost-Austin house (1681), oldest in Cambridge, is just down the street. Raymond Park and playground is nearby as well. The Harvard campus is a short distance away, and in addition to the famous yard proposes the Natural History Museum and its renowned Art Museum. Historic Cambridge Common, where General Washington's troops assembled, is nearby as well. The Porter Square subway stop is a 3-minute walk, and one stop away from Davis square or Harvard Square.

For shopping an errands, we recommend:

Porter Square Post Office
Porter Square Book store
Caffe Nero
Cafe Bourbon
The Abbey (bistro)
Bagelsaurus bakery
The Toad (cozy live music bar)
Christopher's (bistro and sports bar)
Colette Wine Bar and Restaurant
Yume Wo Katare ramen bar
Lunder Arts Cen
host_about: Marie and Andrew have been living in Cambridge for nearly twenty years. Marie grew up in the romantic city of Paris, and is now a filmmaker, script writer, and university instructor. She also loves to cook and read. Andrew hails from the south, moved to Paris to study architecture, and now runs a design and visualization practice in Cambridge. Andrew and Marie love to travel and strike up unexpected friendships.

name: Private Rm, Close to MIT/Kendall/MGH/Harvard, 30+
description:
Please note:
(1) This is an attic room with sloped, low ceiling.
(2) No access to kitchen. Guests can use shared fridge, shared microwave and hot/cold drinking water fountain.
(2) No bathroom on this floor. Must use shared bath on the 1st or 2nd floors.
(3) Laundromat one block away.
(4) Rental bike available for $30/month.
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood houses one of the best-known high-tech and innovation hubs of the United States and arguably has the highest concentration of PhD's in the world.

However, this neighborhood is probably the most "below the radar" for tourists, but what it lacks in glamour it more than makes up for it in total, earnest hidden-gem-ness. Cruise down its main aorta, Cambridge Street, for access to some of the best fish markets, Portuguese bakeries, and well-loved bars in town. Mall rats can get their fill between the Cambridgeside Galleria and the Twin City Plaza shopping center, but one would be remiss to pass up stylish treasures at the Cambridge Antique Market. The residential makeup is richly diverse, anchored with strong Irish and Portuguese communities. Local pride runs thick.

This neighborhood houses one of the best-known high-tech and innovation hubs of the United States and arguably has the highest concentration of PhD's in the world.

However, this neighborhood is probably the most "below the radar" for tourists, but what it lacks in glamour it more than makes up for it in total, earnest hidden-gem-ness. Cruise down its main aorta, Cambridge Street, for access to some of the best fish markets, Portuguese bakeries, and well-loved bars in town. Mall rats can get their fill between the Cambridgeside Galleria and the Twin City Plaza shopping center, but one would be remiss to pass up stylish treasures at the Cambridge Antique Market. The residential makeup is richly diverse,anchored with strong Irish and Portuguese communities. Local pride runs thick.

The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. Steps to grocery stores, restaurants, theatre and great night scenes in Davis Square. Fresh linens and towels. 1 queen bed. 1 sofa bed. Updated bathroom. Coffee machine, WiFi. Shared deck.
neighborhood_overview: We are a 3-minute walk to grocery stores, subway, hardware store, bookstore and many restaurants. Our neighborhood is located on a quiet street, while providing the convenience of being literally steps to the Red Line Porter Square train station. We are about 15-minute walk to Harvard (or 1 stop after walking directly to the subway station across the street). If you take the subway or bus, you can get to Harvard in less than 10 minutes. Red Line also takes you directly to downtown Boston.
host_about: Hello I’m Tina! I’m a host in Boston. I’m an avid traveler and I enjoy making friends with people from all over the world. I look forward to hosting you! :)

name: Blueground | Kendall Sq, gym, nr mit & river
description: Discover the best of Cambridge, with this studio apartment in Kendall Square. with views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this lavishly Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, cozy living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BOS72)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

description: *32+ night stays only*. Luxury two-bedroom condo at a prime location in Cambridge, close to Harvard, MIT, Kendall Square and downtown Boston. The bus is one-minute away and Kendall Square is within walking distance. Short walk to the T stations. Near shops, grocery stores, restaurants and tourist scenes. 2 queen beds and 1 queen air mattress. High-quality mattresses, beddings, linens. High-end furnishings in a designer space. Nespresso. Modern kitchen, wifi, AC in every room. In-unit laundry.
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is located on a quiet street, while providing the convenience of being close to MIT, Harvard, Kendall Square, Central Square, and downtown Boston. There are many shops, bars and restaurants within walking distance, about 1-13 minute walk depending on where you want to go.

You will be able to walk to grocery stores and pharmacy near the subway station in 5-15 minutes, so you may enjoy the comfort of a quiet neighborhood and the convenience of shops nearby. Depending on what you're hoping to do while in town, we are happy to make suggestions and help you have the best time possible when you visit.
host_about:
Hello, we are Yan’s hosting team. We are full-time property managers. Our hosting team is always happy to help so please don't hesitate to contact us anytime! :)

We love hosting people in Boston because it's an exciting city full of culture and history. In our free time, we like to go out with friends, travel, as well as enjoy all the fun activities that Boston has to offer. Our style of hosting is flexible because everyone's needs are different. We want to make your stay enjoyable and help you meet your goal of staying here. We look forward to hosting you! :)

name: Harvard Studio-Parking-Laundry-Kitchen-Queen Bed
description:
Simple studio apartment w/ kitchen, in-unit laundry, direct access parking, full bathroom, queen bed, couch, tv w/ fire stick, high speed internet, A/C, big windows facing back yard, and more. The space is ideal for 1-2 people but we can offer a blow up mattress for a child upon request.

Our home is on a quiet side street but only one block from Massachusetts Ave with many restaurants and shops just around the corner. 10-15 minute walk to both Harvard and Porter Squares and Red line T stops.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is great!  Our home is on a quiet side street but steps from all you could need.  Around the corner is a starbucks, local coffee shops, high end restaurants, casual restaurants, bars, live music, ice cream, pizza, pharmacy, parks, etc.  All literally within a 3-5 minute walk.  Walking 10-15 minutes is harvard square in one direction and porter square in the other.  We are across the street from Harvard Law School and Lesley University and a 10 minute walk to Harvard Yard.  The red line Train runs right through Harvard and Porter which will bring you to downtown Boston in less than 30 minutes.
host_about:
My husband and I are working professionals with two children and have lived in the Boston/Cambridge area for over 10 years.  We love to visit local parks, dine out, and be tourists in our own city, especially when friends/family come to visit.  There is so much to do and see, we'd be happy to provide recommendations!

We also love to travel as a family.  When we look for an airbnb, our focus is on clean, convenient, and affordable.  That's what we aim to provide for our guests, a place where you feel clean and comfortable and have all the conveniences we can provide.  At our home you will have your own laundry, direct access parking spot, high speed internet, a big TV with smart features, air conditioning, and a compact but fully functional kitchen.  If you travel anything like us, we think you'll be very happy and we look forward to being your host!

name: Blueground | Harvard Sq, w/d nr red line
description: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this stylish Harvard Square furnished two bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and pretty living room with great balcony views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS90)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located at Harvard Square, a triangular plaza near the center of Cambridge, Massachusetts. 'The Square' (as it is sometimes referred to locally) is both a commercial and residential center. Bookstores, theatres and music venues line the streets and enhance the energetic atmosphere. The neighborhood's central location, close proximity to university campuses and many public transportation options make it a bustling hub for people of all ages. During the day, take a stroll and discover the area's tranquil scenery. At night, there are countless bar and entertainment options. On the T, Downtown is a 15 minute ride while Logan International Airport is 30 minutes away.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Quiet, private, garden apt near Harvard/MIT
description:
Quiet, elegant garden apartment for 4 adults (+ infant). Modern & filled with light. Gorgeous backyard with gas grill, dining table, and sofa. Easy free street parking. Big chef's kitchen. Free front-loading washer & dryer inside.

IF YOU CANCEL, I WILL ISSUE A REFUND IF SOMEONE ELSE BOOKS YOUR DATES.

Map our location using the intersection of Kinnaird and Jay. We're an 8 minute walk to the metro.

Even if you stay elsewhere, download a copy of my Guidebook (in the Photos section).
neighborhood_overview: Total privacy and quiet.  Keyless entry.  Three blocks from the gorgeous Charles River.  Midway between Harvard Square and Central Square.  Map location: the intersection of Kinnaird and Jay.  Easy walk to Harvard Business School, undergraduate, and law campuses.  MIT is close by.  There are tons of great restaurants and bars, and a nearby gym that offers day passes.  Lots of nice parks for kids very nearby.  Street parking is easy, and the permit will be waiting for you on your arrival.
host_about: I am an emergency doctor. My wife and daughter and I live upstairs from our Airbnb apartment. We would love to have you stay in our place...although you'll probably never see us, thanks to the separate entrance, sound insulation, and overall total privacy. Welcome!

name: Upstairs in Central Square
description: Welcome to Upstairs in Central Square! This is two bedroom apartment in the heart of Cambridge.  With an extra fold out futon bed for extra guests.  Great light on this third floor walk up that's set back a block from Mass Ave, so its surprisingly quiet.  Located right in between MIT and Harvard, in the bustling and fun Central Square, the T is a mere 30 second walk away to whisk you away to all parts Boston in minutes!
host_about:
I spent most of my adult life traveling around the globe from my home base in Portland,Oregon... sometimes staying in people's house, sometimes just a hammock between two trees.  I am currently indoctrinating my son to like these things so we can hit the road when he gets a wee bit older.  My last trip was across India by bicycle.  Good fun if you get the chance!

Since I've been in Cambridge, I've learned things that would be not possible while traveling, learning the guitar, making beer, perfecting my jerk chicken burritos...and I've grown to love this town...lively music scene, and the biking is getting better and better!

description: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS177)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: The NERDpartment in the heart of Cambridge
description:
Our lovely apartment was former worker's housing built during the late 1880s for the labor force nearby the railway to Boston. Located in the heart of East Cambridge, we're 15 minutes walk from MIT/Kendall and Bunker Hill, and 25 minutes walk from Harvard.

With the disappearance of the railways and the rise of high-tech, most of our tenants, including yours truly, have been academics and students of the many universities nearby!
neighborhood_overview:
We have a series of lovely Portugese, Brazilian and Italian restaurants near by Cambridge street. Elmendorf Bakery and cafe, is right around the corner, and 9Zaab Thai place is less than a minute walk!

Along with the popular Lone Star Taco Bar, easy going pizza place of Aram's #2, and cozy bar/restaurant of Portuglia.

Other than food, we are in a highly walkable family neighbourhood with plenty of parks and between two large local libraries. Very close to a nearby Starmarket, and a strip mall. There's also a laundromat less than 30 seconds walk from our door to make up for our lack of laundry options in unit.
host_about: Hello! I'm a explorer at heart and love to see the world, really looking forward to hearing about your experiences and perspectives!

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Blueground | Central Sq, gym, doorman, nr t
description: Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this cozy one bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Central Square home . (ID #BOS256)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

Harvard Square boasts historic red brick walkways and tree-lined blocks full of restaurants, shops, museums, entertainment centers and bookstores. The nearby Central Square is teeming with eclectic restaurants, bars, live music venues and small theaters. . Cambridge is an easy commute from downtown Boston via the “T” and the bus. name: Stylish One Bedroom Apartment Near MIT and Harvard
description: This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 25 years of experience in the industry. neighborhood_overview: Cambridge, Massachusetts is a charming, diverse city adjacent to Boston with beautiful views of the Charles River. A college town home to Harvard University and MIT, Cambridge is on the cutting edge of education, research and development. Residents of Cambridge enjoy being in the Greater Boston area without the hustle and bustle of Boston proper, creating the perfect balance between urban living and a suburban feel. Students attending college and living in the area hail from all over the world, giving Cambridge a worldly, international flavor. Harvard Square boasts historic red brick walkways and tree-lined blocks full of restaurants, shops, museums, entertainment centers and bookstores. The nearby Central Square is teeming with eclectic restaurants, bars, live music venues and small theaters. . Cambridge is an easy commute from downtown Boston via the “T” and the bus. Kendall Square and Central Square are within walking distance of Boston, just over the Charles River.
host_about: Furnished Quarters has been helping people stay different for over 25 years. Driven by a passion for providing reliable short-term housing solutions worldwide, we aim to empower our guests with a seamless experience. Our prime locations in sought-after destinations, 24/7 guest service, expert design, and hand-picked furnishings in every one of our high-quality homes come together to create a simplified but sophisticated stay, every time.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple Google search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston.

description: Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this beautiful two bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Porter Square home with stunning views over the city. (ID #BOS319)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Porter Square, Cambridge near the intersection of Somerville and Massachusetts Avenue. The area is always buzzing with activity and offers a wide range of goods and services such as coffee shops, supermarkets and gyms. There are more unique options as well though like a Japantown mall and a live music venue. Widely known for having a diverse restaurant scene, people flock from all over to have a meal here. Full of students and young professionals, Porter Square is easily reached via the MBTA Red Line and the Commuter Rail. Originally named for Porter’s Hotel which used to be the center of the square, Porter Square has evolved into an area offering something for everyone.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Central Square - Between Harvard & MIT
description:
On a quiet residential street, two blocks away from Central Square and the MBTA (subway and busses).

Apt is close to Harvard, MIT, public transportation, bars, restaurants, coffeehouses, grocery stores.

Apt is far enough back from Mass Ave that it feels like a neighborhood, but close enough that you're minutes away from the action.

A good place for students, solo adventurers and business travelers.
neighborhood_overview:
3 minute walk to bars, restaurants, coffeehouses, grocery stores (Target, H-Mart), fitness centers (BSC, VIM Fitness), Cambridge Public Library.

Also walking distance to Boston's Back Bay, Harvard Square, MIT, the Charles River (biking, jogging, walking trails), Trader Joe’s, Micro Center, Whole Foods, Inman Square.

- Miracle of Science Bar & Grill (beers on tap & a food menu designed like a periodic table)
- Asgard Irish Pub & Restaurant (karaoke & trivia nights)
- Little Donkey (global tapas)
- Thelonious Monkfish
- Craigie On Main

Coffeehouses:
- Starbucks
- Dunkin Donuts
- 1369 Coffee House
- Caffe Nero
- Andala Coffee House
...and many more.

Groceries:
- Target
- H Mart
- Whole Foods

name: Modern Suite in Kendall/MIT
description: Right at the heart of Kendall/MIT, minutes away from the Kendall Red line and Lechmere Green line, this modern, Scandinavian inspired home is the perfect place for your Boston/Cambridge business or travel stay.  A short walk to the Charles River and the Beacon Hill area, as well as steps away from the coffee shops, great restaurants, and  bio-tech businesses of Kendall, you are in the prime location to get anywhere from MIT, Biotech and Tech companies, to Beacon Hill, and Newbury Street.
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the Kendall Square area, right next to MIT. From here, you can walk to the Charles River in 10 minutes and once over the bridge, you are in Boston! From the trains that are within walking distance from the house, you can easily get to Boston or Harvard Square. Additionally, you are close to Central Square, Inman Square, Cambridge Crossing, and Union Square in Somerville.

This neighborhood has a lot of amazing restaurants, cafes, breweries, and more! We are happy to share recommendations!

name: Blueground | Porter Sq, close to harvard sq
description: Discover the best of Cambridge, with this one bedroom apartment in Porter Square. with views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this elegantly Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, cozy living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BOS339)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Porter Square, Cambridge near the intersection of Somerville and Massachusetts Avenue. The area is always buzzing with activity and offers a wide range of goods and services such as coffee shops, supermarkets and gyms. There are more unique options as well though like a Japantown mall and a live music venue. Widely known for having a diverse restaurant scene, people flock from all over to have a meal here. Full of students and young professionals, Porter Square is easily reached via the MBTA Red Line and the Commuter Rail. Originally named for Porter’s Hotel which used to be the center of the square, Porter Square has evolved into an area offering something for everyone.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: (SQ) Large room with private bath in Harvard/MIT
description: This private room is located in the heart of Cambridge in Central Square surrounded by lots of restaurants, bars and transportation. You will enjoy the privacy of your space with your personal fridge in this Victorian-era house. Entry to the unit is through the main floor with a passcode lock.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
