name: Spacious Inman Sq Apt mins from MIT/Harvard
description: This clean, spacious apartment is in an amazing location for exploring the Greater Boston area. Within easy walking distance of Harvard and Central Squares & MBTA, it is steps from two major bus lines and surrounded by an array of great restaurants. Our family has lived here for generations and the decor reflects our Cambridge roots.  There is room here for the whole family to relax after a busy day of sightseeing and a fully equipped kitchen if you need a break from eating out.
neighborhood_overview: Inman Square is known for its independently operated businesses and its many great restaurants.  Things are bouncing back now that the worst of the pandemic is past.  You can walk to pretty much everything you need, or hop onto a bus or train to get to great colleges and universities, museums, historical sights, and shopping adventures.  We're not far from natural wonders, either.  You can take a ferry to Boston's Harbor Islands, Provincetown, and the National Seashore, you can drive to Thoreau's Walden Pond, or you can walk along the banks of the Charles River.

name: MIT/Kendall Lux 3BR Apartment
description:
This spacious 3-bed apt sleeps up to 8. All three bedrooms have a queen-size bed and feature comfortable mattresses, soft linens, and plenty of closet space. It includes a fully equipped kitchen with modern appliances, and the dining area has a large table that seats up to six people.

The apartment is situated in the heart of Cambridge, close to many of the city's top attractions, universities, and restaurants. Public transportation is easily accessible, with several bus and train stops nearby.
neighborhood_overview:
Cambridge is a city known for its world-renowned universities, cultural diversity, and eclectic dining and shopping options. Whether you're a student, a business traveler, or a tourist looking for a unique and authentic experience, Cambridge has something for everyone.

Just steps from the apartment, you'll find a variety of restaurants, cafes, and bars offering delicious cuisine from around the world. From traditional New England seafood to international delicacies, there's no shortage of dining options to explore.

Cambridge is also home to many of the world's top universities, including Harvard University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). Take a stroll through the picturesque Harvard Yard or visit the MIT Museum to learn about the city's rich academic history.

For those looking for outdoor activities, Cambridge has several parks and nature reserves to explore. The Charles River Esplanade offers scenic views of the city skyline and is

name: 800 Square Foot, 2-bed Apt w/ AC, Laundry, Parking
description:
Large 800 square foot (75 square meter) solar powered, garden level, 2-bedroom apartment in Cambridge with private entrance, central air/heat, walk-in shower, full-size washer and dryer, kitchen, and two smart TVs with apps.

We offer free off-street parking for 1 car and are in walking distance to Davis Square (red-line subway station, restaurants and bars, shops, bowling, and theater).

The owners live upstairs and are happy to answer any questions during your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
The location is great for easy access to Harvard and Tufts universities and only 5 subway stops to downtown Boston (a 13 minute ride). Massachusetts Avenue is a block away with numerous restaurants and markets.

Davis Square is a 10 minute walk away and packed with restaurants, shops, cafes, bars, clubs, a theater, bowling alley, and supermarket.

The surrounding streets are primarily residential so it's typically very quiet at night for a city. However, we're still just one block away from tons of amenities.
host_about:
We are a gay couple in our 50's splitting our time between Cambridge, Massachusetts, (Davis Square area) and our summer houses in Provincetown, MA, and near Ogunquit, ME. We rent out all three properties if you're interested in any of our listings

Our interests include travel, architecture, wine, board games and cards games, and dinners out with friends.

We lived in Tokyo, Japan, for two years and that's where we got our start using AirBnB - as hosts and guests. We've also lived in various parts of the United States; including Boston, Cape Cod, and Salem (MA), Roanoke (VA), plus San Francisco and Irvine (CA).

neighborhood_overview: The vibrant college town of Cambridge keeps finding ways to charm. Red brick buildings, parks and public spaces, cultural attractions, and an invigorating pace of life give the feel of a buzzing European hotspot, where an eclectic mix of young tech professionals and the lively campus communities of Harvard and MIT spill over into the area’s many restaurants, cosy bars, and craft coffee shops. Sitting along the north bank of the Charles River just a few T stops away from downtown Boston, Cambridge’s leafy, sustainably-minded neighborhoods are bursting with things to see and do for every season.

Welcome to STARS of Boston (Short Term Apartment Rental Solutions) -- our name says it all! We offer stylishly furnished and accessorized apartments as superior value alternatives to hotels. Our private rooms, studio, one, two, three & four bedroom apartments and homes have been carefully curated to provide a refuge for work, play or rejuvenation.

name: Deluxe Queen at Ginkgo House
description: This sun-filled large bedroom is situated on the second floor our large Victorian-style house. It has four large windows with ample natural light and a view of our lovely ginkgo trees in the front. The room has one queen bed, and two twin beds for a perfect family stay up to four people, two adults and two children. This centrally situated house is only 7 minute walk from the red line subway station, 10 minute walk to Harvard, and a WholeFoods within 5 minute walk.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

name: (SG) Bright, cozy room with two beds, shared bath
description: Blending modern conveniences with historic charm in this 1867 Victorian-style house, this guest room has one full size bed and a single bed. In addition, the room can be booked together adjacent guest room for a larger group up to 4 people. If booked together, the combined ensuite is consisted of two bedrooms, with the private bathroom located in the larger guest room. Located just 7 minutes from the Red Line T, we are at the heart of Cambridge between Harvard and MIT.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

neighborhood_overview:
WHAT I LIKE ABOUT THIS PLACE:
(1) INTELLECTUAL HUB
This house is just minutes' walk from the world's center of innovation and intellectualism - MIT and its Technology Square. And we are not far from Harvard or MGH! (8 min bike ride)

(2) NEIGHBORHOOD
While my place is nestled in a quiet, safe residential neighborhood, it is also close to the vibrancy of Kendall Square and supermarkets & eateries in Cambridge Street.

(3) COMFORT
Your comfort is our priority. We want you to pamper yourself with this Select Luxury 10-inch AirFlow Memory Foam mattress and star hotel bedlinen.

(4) CLEANNESS
We hire professional cleaners to make your room ready for you after the preceding guests leave. We take pride in our "cleanness."

(5) EASY CHECK-IN AND CHECK-OUT
Two days before your arrival, we will send you Self Check-In Guide with the entry code to access your room.

(6) SECURITY
Keyless lock on your private door

name: Blueground | Cambridge, private access to park
description: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this beautiful Alewife furnished two bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and pretty living room with great views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS469)
neighborhood_overview: This turnkey furnished apartment is located in Alewife, a fast-growing Cambridge neighborhood. There are plenty of cafes, restaurants and shops clustered around Alewife's T station. Anyone who likes to cook for themselves will be pleased by the selection at Ferro's Foodtown, a popular grocery store. Nature lovers can hike, bike, and birdwatch in the Alewife Brook Reservation. Alewife is served by several MBTA bus lines as well as the Red Line.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Superior Queen 5 min from T
description: This sun-filled private bath guest room is situated on the second floor our large Victorian-style house. It has two large windows with ample natural light and a view of our lovely garden on the side. The room has one full bed, and a full-size sofa bed to fit up to three people. This centrally situated house is only 7 minute walk from the red line subway station, 10 minute walk to Harvard, and a WholeFoods within 5 minute walk.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

You’ll love this stylish East Cambridge furnished one bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and beautiful living room with great views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS461)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live. With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Newly renovated 3bed/2ba apt Davis/Harvard/Porter
description: Newly renovated modern 3 bed, 2 bath, spacious & sunny entire apartment in the heart of Cambridge, 10 min drive to Boston. Great location with walking distance to Davis & Porter Sq (8 min walk), Harvard Sq (25 min walk). Close to MIT, Harvard, Lesley, and Tufts. Close to public transportations, red line, commuter rail (North station), bus stops (3 min), direct line to Downtown Boston. Restaurants, cafes, bars, theaters, grocery stores & shops. Tennis court, bicycle trail, parks, Fresh Pond Lake.
host_about: Hi, Gayane & Jean Marc Nelson welcome you in Cambridge!

name: 3 BDR APT full eat-in kitchen & in-unit laundry
description:
You’ll love this spacious three-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, quality mattresses and roomy living room. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! One block from Central Square T, coffee shops, H-mart, Target and more.

Listing says minimum of 91 days but 30+ days will be accepted please ask.
neighborhood_overview: We are steps away from central square and a 15 minute walk to Harvard or MIT.
host_about: A long time resident of Cambridge, I love living in this culturally diverse city right between some of the best educational institutions in the world. I am excited to now be a host and share our home with others coming to experience Cambridge.

name: Family Queen at Ginkgo House
description: Welcome to the Ginkgo House, a Victorian era house built in 1867 with  modern amenities. This is a simply decorated family-style room located on the third floor of the house with private bathroom consist of one queen size bed, two singe beds, a study desk, and a mini fridge. Plenty of lights with three windows and a skylight. Shared common areas include living room, dining room, and kitchen; high speed WiFi.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

name: Come Stay at One of BEST Locations in the City~
description:
Kick back and relax in this lovely 2Bedroom Apartment where public transportation is easily accessible and convenient walking distance to Harvard Square and Central Square, which are local historical landmarks and where one will find plenty of stores, restaurants, pharmacies, movie theaters, etc.

You will be minutes from many colleges & universities like Harvard University, Lesley University College of Art & Science, Massachusetts Institute of Technology and many others.
neighborhood_overview:
Apartment is located in a community referred to as Cambridgeport, the beautiful Charles River sits behind the building and on weekends Memorial Drive is closed off for street festivals, bikers, boating events, etc.

Since so close to many historical landmarks there’s always adventure to be taken. Being in Cambridge your in an amazing position to access many parks & recreational activities, museums, art galleries, The Freedom Trail, science centers, the Aquarium and much more.
host_about:
Friendly warm hearted home...

Better Together is our motto and do unto others as you would like done unto you!!!

name: W Cambridge 4BR/2.5BA on bike path, yard, light!
description:
Beautiful 4BR/2.5BA on 2nd and 3rd floor in quiet W Cambridge. Two balconies, shared backyard on bike path connecting to Minuteman and Charles.

Gut-renovated 2023. Space, light, and a real-home feeling!

Apt is on a quiet residential street 1/2 block from Fresh Pond, a tranquil, forested 2.5 mile loop around a Cambridge drinking water reservoir.

Your rental is the entire 2nd and 3rd floor of a two-family home. We, the owners, live here and Airbnb it when traveling.
neighborhood_overview:
West Cambridge is all the convenience of Cambridge with... an actual backyard!

Our street is very quiet, mostly families, and minutes from Fresh Pond, a lovely 2.5 mile loop around a reservoir which is off-leash dog friendly.

Minutes from Belmont, Watertown, Cambridge, and Somerville hot spots.

Free, ample street parking.

name: NEW Remodeled 2 Bedroom-Cambridge/Harvard/MIT
description:
Located just outside of Harvard Square and only steps away from scenic walking/jogging/biking paths along the Charles River. This newly renovated, light-filled, spacious(1200 Sq Ft) two bedroom with one and a half bath has been tastefully redesigned.

Whether you are studying or visiting one of the over 70 local universities, on a work trip, or just taking a little vacation you will thoroughly enjoy your stay.
neighborhood_overview: Just around the corner from Harvard University, Mt Auburn Hospital, restaurants, bars, and coffee shops, with great access to public transportation; This cozy basement apartment is fully furnished with comfortable, modern accents. The Unit is located on Mt Auburn Street Between Longfellow & Channing. This is in a safe, friendly, clean, and vibrant neighborhood. Minutes walk from the Charles River, Harvard Sq., Redline, Harvard University, Mt Auburn Hospital, and Huron Village.
host_about:
We are both designers and love what we do :-) Jordan owns a Design Firm in Boston and Larissa is a landscape architect.  We have both spent a lot of time traveling and met while working in San Francisco (one of our favorite places). We have have two young daughters and split or time between our time between Cambridge, MA and Ogunquit, ME when we are not traveling. Larissa is European so we frequently Travel to Europe to see friends and family in Germany, Turkey, Italy and France. Jordan's work also often brings him to Asia and the west coast.

We enjoy the outdoors as much as possible both beach and mountains. We are also pretty active we enjoy everything from Yoga to Biking to Surfing.  We are also into food and enjoy cooking and BBQing whenever we have time. 

We have been using AirBNB for over 3 yrs now. We have a good amount of experience hosting and really do enjoy meeting so many interesting people. As a host we are pretty hands off but there is we are needed. As long as our rules are observed it will be easy sailing for all. Looking forward having you as a guest.

name: Sunny 1-bedroom apartment near Davis Square
description:
Peaceful apartment with great natural lighting in a safe, walkable neighborhood and central location VERY close to the Davis Sq. T stop on the Red Line (8 mins on foot or 4 mins by BlueBike).

From Davis Station you can be at Harvard Square in 6 mins, MIT in 13 mins, and the Downtown Boston in 20 mins.
neighborhood_overview:
Cambridge and Somerville neighborhoods near this apartment are very safe. No issues walking around here, even late at night. Dropped items are often returned to the owners.

2-minute walk to a liquor store. 8-minute walk to Davis Square - featuring lots of bars, restaurants, breweries, markets, coffee shops, etc.
host_about:
Hi! I'm originally from Malaysia, but I've lived in Buenos Aires and Singapore before moving to Los Angeles for college. I currently live in Boston with my partner, who is studying at MIT. I have a remote job as an arts administrator, and counting my lucky stars to be able to work from anywhere with an internet connection!

Another side-effect of frequent moving: I get restless and I love to travel and explore new places.

Food, art, music, museums and great company are the highlights of my trips!

name: Harvard Square-MIT-Boston - Unique 1 Bedroom Stay
description:
Welcome to a one-of-a-kind Airbnb experience that goes beyond the ordinary and immerses you in the captivating ambiance of Harvard Square.

At our uniquely stylish Airbnb, we are continuing to curate. Easy Commute to Boston- Steps to Red Line

FOR NEW airbnb user, below are some of the FAQ links for your perusal (questions & answers useful for new user). Please do let me know if you have any problem, my response would be faster than airbnb support team as sometimes their hotline as very busy (but I only can help you on general question).

GENERAL FAQ for guests before booking
www.airbnb.com/help/topic/traveling

FAQ: What are Airbnb Service Fees?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/104

FAQ: For How to Book
www.airbnb.com/help/question/85

FAQ: For How to make a payment / reservation
Please message me first before you book with the number of guests including kids. Tax of 13% is added on to the total and sent. 

FAQ: For How to Contact Airbnb Support
www.airbnb.com/help/question/9

FAQ: How and when do I make a payment for my reservation?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/92

FAQ: How can I view or print a billing receipt or itinerary for my trip?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/100

FAQ: How are cleaning fees added?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/58

FAQ: How does the Airbnb payment system work?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/51

Contact Number and Email Information will only be released until a booking is made.

Below is the FAQ on airbnb “Why can’t I call or email a host before booking?”: www.airbnb.com/help/question/111

We strongly recommend reviewing all cancellation policies before making your reservations: www.airbnb.com/home/cancellation_policies

Hope this helps you get to know how airbnb works :-)

For Pricing, at the listing page, enter check in date, check out date and total number of guests. The system will auto generate the price for your consideration. Regarding the currency display, it depends on your own setting, you can change your currency setting at the lower left panel of your airbnb page under the "LANGUAGE", you will see "CURRENCY" setting. Just click on it to change to any currency that you wish to display.

- Return Customer or Host or Guest with positive reviews with whatever possible discount on top of their daily / weekly / month rate OR VIP customer that keep booking over certain accumulated nights that I will offer extra discount OR Customer who had referred me many booking :-)

name: Bright 1 BR apt for rent in Cambridge
description:
Keep it simple at this peaceful and centrally-located place. Perfect apartment to explore all that Cambridge has to offer! Windows line the entire apartment, which lends itself to a lot of beautiful light during the day. (There are shades/curtains on all windows to block out any unwanted light.) The fully-functioning kitchen opens up to the family room, allowing for concurrent cooking and conversation.

Long-term stays only (91 nights or longer).
neighborhood_overview: 5 min. walk from Central Square and 15 min. walk to Harvard Square, both of which are very vibrant. Close walking distance to Inman Square and Union Square, as well as the Charles River (great for walking & running!). Cambridge has a ton of great and varied restaurant, bar, and brewery choices and new ones are always coming!
host_about: I love to travel and try to "live like the locals" when I do so (am up for any suggestions!). I like to stay active and am big into fitness and trying new things on this front. I can't live without music.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.
host_about:

With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live. With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

description: Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this cheery one bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Central Square home with stunning views over the city. (ID #BOS614)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Charming Apartment in the Heart of Cambridge!
description: Whether you're a traveling professional or an urban adventurer, this Cambridge vacation rental will make you feel right at home. Nestled between Harvard and Central Squares, this 2-bedroom, 1-bathroom apartment gives you easy access to public transportation, several restaurants, the Dr. Paul Dudley White Bike Path, and Riverbend Park. Highlighted by tasteful decor, 3 Smart TVs, a well-equipped kitchen, and an in-unit washer/dryer set, this home has everything you need for a stress-free stay.
neighborhood_overview:
CAMBRIDGE HANGOUTS: Harvard Art Museums (0.7 miles), Sanders Theater (0.8 miles), Harvard University (0.9 miles), The Harvard Museum of Natural History (1.1 miles), Massachusetts Institute of Technology (1.1 miles), Museum of Science (3.6 miles)
OUTDOOR ADVENTURE: Dr. Paul Dudley White Bike Path (0.1 miles), Riverbend Park (0.4 miles), Hoyt Field (0.4 miles), Wheeler Park (0.5 miles)
DINE + DRINK: The Nu Do’ Society (0.5 miles), Dumping House (0.5 miles), Daedalus (0.6 miles), Beantown Taqueria Cafe (0.6 miles), Brick & Mortar (0.9 miles)
TRANSPORTATION: Central Square (0.8 miles), Harvard Square (0.8 miles)
AIRPORT: Boston Logan International Airport (7.5 miles)

name: Prentiss House by Thatch | King Room #2
description: Prentiss House by Thatch is a 20-room boutique hotel nestled between Harvard and Porter Square in an iconic Cambridge neighborhood setting. Built in 1843 and renovated in 2022, the building’s rich architecture is complimented by modern amenities and fresh design, providing an upscale yet laid-back atmosphere. Using state of the art technology, roaming staff and a virtual front desk, most guests enjoy their stay without ever needing assistance from our staff.
neighborhood_overview: The hotel resides on a quiet residential street in the Baldwin neighborhood of central Cambridge. In the summer of 2021, the Baldwin neighborhood was named after black educator, Maria Baldwin who worked hard to represent the importance of racial justice and opportunities for women of color within Cambridge and beyond. To each side of the Baldwin neighborhood, lies Harvard and Porter square with Massachusetts Avenue serving as a connecter of the two. Directly to the east, the neighborhood borders the nearby city of Somerville. Surrounded by top institutions, there’s no shortage of activities, bars, and restaurants to experience during your stay at Prentiss House.
host_about: Thatch is an ever-evolving hospitality management company that specializes in co-living, hotels and apartment-hotels for short and long stays. Founded in 2010, Thatch's goal is to make Boston more accessible by providing innovative housing and hotel concepts at prices and on terms that put the value in hospitality back where it belongs - with the guests. We do this by stripping out non-essential services and amenities - like daily room cleaning and on-site food and beverage - and by centralizing our staff. In exchange, Thatch guests are afforded privacy, independence and more room in their travel budgets. Simple. Flexible. Functional. That's Thatch.

name: Blueground | Kendall Sq, gym & concierge, nr mit
description: Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this stylish studio Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Kendall Square home with stunning views over the city. (ID #BOS647)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: M2) Modern Camb2Br2bt nr Davis Subwy Harvard Tufts
description: Located conveniently on Mass Ave in Cambridge, this updated 2b/2b is short walk from Davis Sq through a lovely tree-line bike path. Find all you need in everyday life from restaurants to shops to banks. You can move-in and start your life immediately with ease. Hop on MBTA buses to Harvard right in front of the next building. Perfect for Academic year or longer term lease. Sip your drinks at courtyard sitting/dining area while surfing web or reading in the outdoor breeze or sunshine!
host_about:
I've been an Airbnb host for few years now and recently had a pleasure of being a guest so I know what people expect from a Host and a Guest. 
I truly enjoy hosting Airbnb and I think it's a great community of people, almost like a world web of great hosts and guests.
As for me I'm very sociable person and Airbnb gives me an opportunity to meet different people each time.
I also like to keep things clean and organized and spend most of my time reading books, doing research on a healthy lifestyle and of course trying to live one! :)
"A ship in the harbor is safe, but that's not what ships are built for."

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live. With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.

name: Prentiss House by Thatch | King Rm #3
description: Prentiss House by Thatch is a 20-room boutique hotel nestled between Harvard and Porter Square in an iconic Cambridge neighborhood setting. Built in 1843 and renovated in 2022, the building's rich architecture is complimented by modern amenities and fresh design, providing an upscale yet laid-back atmosphere. Using state of the art technology, roaming staff and a virtual front desk, most guests enjoy their stay without ever needing assistance from our staff.
neighborhood_overview: The hotel resides on a quiet residential street in the Baldwin neighborhood of central Cambridge. In the summer of 2021, the Baldwin neighborhood was named after black educator, Maria Baldwin who worked hard to represent the importance of racial justice and opportunities for women of color within Cambridge and beyond. To each side of the Baldwin neighborhood, lies Harvard and Porter square with Massachusetts Avenue serving as a connecter of the two. Directly to the east, the neighborhood borders the nearby city of Somerville. Surrounded by top institutions, there’s no shortage of activities, bars, and restaurants to experience during your stay at Prentiss House.
host_about: Thatch is an ever-evolving hospitality management company that specializes in co-living, hotels and apartment-hotels for short and long stays. Founded in 2010, Thatch's goal is to make Boston more accessible by providing innovative housing and hotel concepts at prices and on terms that put the value in hospitality back where it belongs - with the guests. We do this by stripping out non-essential services and amenities - like daily room cleaning and on-site food and beverage - and by centralizing our staff. In exchange, Thatch guests are afforded privacy, independence and more room in their travel budgets. Simple. Flexible. Functional. That's Thatch.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

description:
Experience the best of Boston: a luxurious blend of historic elegance and modern convenience in the gorgeous original wing of a Victorian mansion.

neighborhood_overview: Ideally located on a charming tree-lined street of historic homes in the central Baldwin (fka Agassiz) neighborhood. This area has a welcoming mix of decades-long residents, newcomers, and visitors;  professors, professionals, families, artists, writers, and scholars. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live. With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.

description: Discover the best of Cambridge, with this one bedroom apartment in Central Square. with views over the city. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Blueground | Harvard Sq, in-unit laundry
description: Discover the best of Cambridge, with this three bedroom apartment in Harvard Square. . It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this stylishly Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, comfortable living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BOS646)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located at Harvard Square, a triangular plaza near the center of Cambridge, Massachusetts. 'The Square' (as it is sometimes referred to locally) is both a commercial and residential center. Bookstores, theatres and music venues line the streets and enhance the energetic atmosphere. The neighborhood's central location, close proximity to university campuses and many public transportation options make it a bustling hub for people of all ages. During the day, take a stroll and discover the area's tranquil scenery. At night, there are countless bar and entertainment options. On the T, Downtown is a 15 minute ride while Logan International Airport is 30 minutes away.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Upscale One Bedroom in Kendall Square -Near MIT/Ha
description: This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 24 years of experience in the industry. The Watermark is a sleek, contemporary apartment complex with brilliant architecture, luxury amenities and the richness of a vibrant neighborhood,  in the Kendall Square section of Cambridge, MA, just across the Charles River and nearby Boston. Building amenities include concierge service, a fitness center, an outdoor terrace, a sky deck, a resident lounge, a grilling area, a Zen garden, private conference space, and more. The property is just steps from the MIT campus, nearby Harvard, as well as several great restaurants, coffee shops, retail establishments, and 2.5 acres of landscaped open space. Exploring the Cambridge and Boston is a breeze as the Kendall/MIT T station, providing access to the Red Line, is just a 3-minute walk from the property.
neighborhood_overview: Cambridge, Massachusetts is a charming, diverse city adjacent to Boston with beautiful views of the Charles River. A college town home to Harvard University and MIT, Cambridge is on the cutting edge of education, research and development. Residents of Cambridge enjoy being in the Greater Boston area without the hustle and bustle of Boston proper, creating the perfect balance between urban living and a suburban feel. Students attending college and living in the area hail from all over the world, giving Cambridge a worldly, international flavor. Harvard Square boasts historic red brick walkways and tree-lined blocks full of restaurants, shops, museums, entertainment centers and bookstores. The nearby Central Square is teeming with eclectic restaurants, bars, live music venues and small theaters. . Cambridge is an easy commute from downtown Boston via the “T” and the bus. Kendall Square and Central Square are within walking distance of Boston, just over the Charles River.
host_about: Furnished Quarters has been helping people stay different for over 25 years. Driven by a passion for providing reliable short-term housing solutions worldwide, we aim to empower our guests with a seamless experience. Our prime locations in sought-after destinations, 24/7 guest service, expert design, and hand-picked furnishings in every one of our high-quality homes come together to create a simplified but sophisticated stay, every time.

name: Tranquil City Retreat Near Harvard and Porter
description: Discover unparalleled convenience at this prime location, just steps from Porter Square. With a 3-minute walk to the red line, reach Harvard in 8 mins, MIT in 14 mins, and MGH in 20 mins. Lesley University, groceries, and cafes are all within a 5-minute stroll. Enjoy a quiet, private room flooded with natural light, alongside shared kitchen and bathroom facilities, offering both convenience, privacy, and affordability. Escape the hefty hotel prices, with neighboring rates soaring to $300/ night
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Porter Square, the epitome of Cambridge charm where safety, tranquility, and convenience converge. Nestled just moments away from Harvard, MIT, and MGH, Porter Square offers a serene residential retreat with easy access to academic excellence and urban excitement. Its central location and seamless access to the Red Line subway ensure effortless exploration of downtown Boston and beyond. Enjoy the peace of mind that comes with a quiet, residential atmosphere while still being steps away from well-stocked grocery stores and an array of restaurants along the vibrant Mass Ave corridor. Porter Square's affordability without compromising on quality of life makes it a coveted destination for visiting scholars, young professionals, and grad students alike. Discover the harmonious blend of safety, tranquility, and convenience that awaits in Porter Square.
host_about:
I am an MIT alum and a tech entrepreneur. Having traveled and worked in many cities across continents, I've been an Airbnb host and a guest many times! 

I love to welcome people to one of my favorite cities, Boston, and show them around. Feel free to ask me any questions!

WALK or Bike to Restaurants, Parks, Tufts, Davis Sq METRO to Harvard, MIT, MGH
neighborhood_overview: Ideally located on a pretty tree-lined, family friendly, on a quiet, residential side street. Leave your car behind as it's totally safe, walkable, and ONLY: steps to the bus stop that goes direct to Harvard Square and Boston; or a quick 2-3 block walk to Davis Square Red Line Metro/ T stop. Walk or bike 1-5 blocks to 30+ restaurants, cafe's, shops, movie cinema, bike rentals, post office, drug store, grocery store, gym, ice-cream, bars, Minuteman bike/jog commuter trail (13+ miles shaded + paved), parks, tennis courts, pool, + public transportation, etc.
host_about: Our family’s background is in medicine, venture capital, academia, oceanography, high tech, dance, and music. As multi-cultural world travelers, educated at Yale, Harvard, Hasso Plattner Institute, Columbia, Grace Hopper, UCDavis, Alvin Ailey, La Scala, and/or the National Ballet of Guatemala, we seek out fun adventures, and spending time with special people. We also enjoy getting to know kind like-minded souls from all over the world and hosting them in our large, new-renovated home now that our 3 kids are launched.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is in Cambridgeport, a charming neighborhood just west of MIT’s campus. It’s a historic area known for Victorian-era homes and tree-lined streets, where the bordering Charles River adds to the neighborhood’s natural allure. In fact, Magazine Beach offers a scenic riverside escape here, making it perfect for picnics or leisurely strolls. Foodies enjoy an eclectic restaurant scene, with plenty of global cuisine, bakeries, and cocktail bars. This neighborhood perfectly balances the comforts of residential living with the vibrancy of city life. It’s a highly desirable spot just north of Boston. For those taking transportation into or out of the neighborhood, the Kendall/MIT or Central stops on the T are a just a short walk away.

Porter Square's affordability without compromising on quality of life makes it a coveted destination for visiting scholars, young professionals, and grad students alike. Discover the harmonious blend of safety, tranquility, and convenience that awaits in Porter Square.

A short walk to the Charles River and the Beacon Hill area, as well as steps away from the coffee shops, great restaurants, and  bio-tech businesses of Kendall, you are in the prime location to get anywhere from Harvard Square to Newbury Street.
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the Kendall Square area, right next to MIT. From here, you can walk to the Charles River in 10 minutes and once over the bridge, you are in Boston! From the trains that are within walking distance from the house, you can easily get to Boston or Harvard Square. Additionally, you are close to Central Square, Inman Square, Cambridge Crossing, and Union Square in Somerville.

This neighborhood has a lot of amazing restaurants, cafes, breweries, and more! We are happy to share recommendations!

name: Wonderful Cambridge Apt. for Short and Long Stays!
description: Spacious and relaxed, this private, 2-bedroom/5-room apartment is located on the first floor of a classic "triple decker" near Porter and Davis Squares.  The apartment has a full kitchen, living and dining room, and access to a shared laundry room. Surrounded by a native plant garden and mature trees, this is a wonderful base for exploring Cambridge's universities, or for longer, sabbatical stays. Harvard Square is one T stop away, or 10 minute by bike / 25 minutes by foot.
neighborhood_overview: This is a culturally diverse, residential neighborhood in Cambridge — located between Porter Square and Huron Village.  The apartment is a 10 minute walk to the Porter Square T station, and 15 or 25 minutes to Davis or Harvard Squares respectively. There is Blue Bike station a block away at Raymond Park, and quick access to multiple parks and green spaces in West/North Cambridge.
host_about:
I live in Cambridge, MA, with my husband, two cats and a thriving native plant garden. 
I love learning people’s stories, and exloring new places, whether distant or local. 
Our properties  are dear to our family. Two, which I share with my sister,  belonged to our vibrant mother, who was a skilled horsewoman and enlightenment seeker. ✨

name: Blueground | Kendall Sq, concierge & gym, nr mit
description: Discover the best of Cambridge, with this one bedroom apartment in Kendall Square. . It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this fashionably Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, stylish living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BOS714)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Convenient Urban Room: Minutes to Harvard/MIT/MGH
description:
Welcome to your ideal urban stay in the heart of Cambridge! Enjoy unparalleled convenience with everything you need just steps away or a quick subway ride from your doorstep.

Nestled in a prime location, the room offers easy access to Porter Square (Red Line), providing seamless transit to Harvard (8 mins), MIT (14 mins), and MGH (20 mins). Lesley University, supermarkets, and an array of cafes and eateries are all within a 5-minute walk, ensuring you have everything within minutes' reach.
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Porter Square, the epitome of Cambridge charm where safety, tranquility, and convenience converge. Nestled just moments away from Harvard, MIT, and MGH, Porter Square offers a serene residential retreat with easy access to academic excellence and urban excitement. Its central location and seamless access to the Red Line subway ensure effortless exploration of downtown Boston and beyond. Enjoy the peace of mind that comes with a quiet, residential atmosphere while still being steps away from well-stocked grocery stores and an array of restaurants along the vibrant Mass Ave corridor. Porter Square's affordability without compromising on quality of life makes it a coveted destination for visiting scholars, young professionals, and grad students alike. Discover the harmonious blend of safety, tranquility, and convenience that awaits in Porter Square.
host_about:
I am an MIT alum and a tech entrepreneur. Having traveled and worked in many cities across continents, I've been an Airbnb host and a guest many times! 

I love to welcome people to one of my favorite cities, Boston, and show them around. Feel free to ask me any questions!

description: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this cozy Central Square furnished one bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and spacious living room with great views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS679)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Prentiss House by Thatch | Deluxe King #17
description: Prentiss House by Thatch is a 20-room boutique hotel nestled between Harvard and Porter Square in an iconic Cambridge neighborhood setting. Built in 1843 and renovated in 2022, the building's rich architecture is complimented by modern amenities and fresh design, providing an upscale yet laid-back atmosphere. Using state of the art technology, roaming staff and a virtual front desk, most guests enjoy their stay without ever needing assistance from our staff.
neighborhood_overview: The hotel resides on a quiet residential street in the Baldwin neighborhood of central Cambridge. In the summer of 2021, the Baldwin neighborhood was named after black educator, Maria Baldwin who worked hard to represent the importance of racial justice and opportunities for women of color within Cambridge and beyond. To each side of the Baldwin neighborhood, lies Harvard and Porter square with Massachusetts Avenue serving as a connecter of the two. Directly to the east, the neighborhood borders the nearby city of Somerville. Surrounded by top institutions, there’s no shortage of activities, bars, and restaurants to experience during your stay at Prentiss House.
host_about: Thatch is an ever-evolving hospitality management company that specializes in co-living, hotels and apartment-hotels for short and long stays. Founded in 2010, Thatch's goal is to make Boston more accessible by providing innovative housing and hotel concepts at prices and on terms that put the value in hospitality back where it belongs - with the guests. We do this by stripping out non-essential services and amenities - like daily room cleaning and on-site food and beverage - and by centralizing our staff. In exchange, Thatch guests are afforded privacy, independence and more room in their travel budgets. Simple. Flexible. Functional. That's Thatch.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

description: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live. With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

Immaculate, tasteful home with new renovations. Rare find!
CLOSE to Harvard, MBTA, lush parks, and downtown Boston.

When you rent this unit, you really are getting full access to a single-family home in the middle of Cambridge with privacy and spaces for relaxing. Enjoy!
neighborhood_overview:
Quiet, residential neighborhood lined with trees, beautiful foliage, plants, and also friendly vibe! Fields, parks, and walking/biking paths all within minutes or less!

Here, you are on the doorstep of everything Cambridge has to offer, but in a quiet and less stressful pocket. Very SAFE at night and easy to walk to/from shops and restaurants in Porter Square and Davis Square. Food/Shopping: Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, Marshalls, Bon Me, Starbucks, Flatbread/Sacco's Bowl Haven, Redbones BBQ, Pemberton Farms. Parks: Danehy Park, Pemberton St. Dog Park, and Fresh Pond are all nearby.
host_about:
Welcome! I have visited 100+ cities since joining Airbnb as a guest. 

We are long-standing hosts on multiple platforms with consistently positive reviews, and have also traveled extensively throughout the entire continental United States, staying at over 65 different Air BNBs, so we have a lot of experience knowing what guests of all different tastes and preferences like, and how to make your time away from home the most comforting and enjoyable possible. We are very accommodating and attentive to detail during your stay. We look forward to hosting you and helping you have the best home base for your time in the Cambridge and Boston area!

name: Spacious Room | Fast Commute to Harvard, MIT, MGH
description:
Amazing location with everything within walking distance or one quick subway ride.

3 mins walk to Porter Square (red line), which leads you to Harvard (8 mins), MIT (14 mins), MGH (20 mins, door to door). 5 mins walk to Lesley University, grocery, and many eateries. Shared dine-in kitchen and bathroom (3 people max) gives you full convenience with enough privacy.
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Porter Square, the epitome of Cambridge charm where safety, tranquility, and convenience converge. Nestled just moments away from Harvard, MIT, and MGH, Porter Square offers a serene residential retreat with easy access to academic excellence and urban excitement. Its central location and seamless access to the Red Line subway ensure effortless exploration of downtown Boston and beyond. Enjoy the peace of mind that comes with a quiet, residential atmosphere while still being steps away from well-stocked grocery stores and an array of restaurants along the vibrant Mass Ave corridor. Porter Square's affordability without compromising on quality of life makes it a coveted destination for visiting scholars, young professionals, and grad students alike. Discover the harmonious blend of safety, tranquility, and convenience that awaits in Porter Square.

description: Must love dogs. Bruno is the big pup in the profile pic. He is a mixed rottweiler/pitbull but looks like a Lab. The two dogs love to play outside and in when we let them. If you are a dog person and I haven't deterred you, let me tell you more about the apartment. There is much to love about the house, living space, and neighborhood.
neighborhood_overview:
There are a few restaurants literally across the street, a bank, high end grocery store Formaggio, and other cute shops.
About one-half mile west of Harvard Square and Fresh Pond is the Observatory Hill neighborhood. Its neighborhood retail and business center is found around the intersection of Concord and Huron Avenues. Further out Huron Avenue towards Fresh Pond is the set of businesses known as Huron Village. Both of these centers offer a variety of neighborhood restaurants, grocery stores, some small offices, and unique retail and specialty shops that serve the surrounding community.
host_about:
I am Democratic political consultant who travels a lot for business and pleasure both domestically and internationally. My homes are showcases for the various art and handicrafts I have picked up along the way.

I have homes in Kigali, Rwanda, Washington, DC and in Cambridge, MA that  I list on AIRBNB and try to use AIRBNB when I travel as well. 

My brother Adam manages the Cambridge house most of the time and will be your primary contact should you choose to stay there. My friend Whinock helps me manage guest communications in Kigali  and we have a full staff to support guests there.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Apt in superb Cambridge location
description: Our 3-bedroom, 1 bathroom home is located in the heart of West Cambridge - close to Huron Village, public transportation, Harvard and Porter Square, as well as a short walk to the Charles River.  Walkable to restaurants, local library, coffee shops, clothing stores, many playgrounds and more!! There are hardwood floors throughout the home, generous sized rooms, and a shared backyard for family BBQs or small gatherings.. You would also have access to a parking spot in our driveway.
neighborhood_overview: Located in a wonderfully central area. Easy access to route 2 to head out west, very close to multiple red line stops that can take you into Boston, and walking distance to many stores, restaurants, and community resources (playgrounds, library, public pools, etc). Located right in Huron village, the home is walking distance to delicious Peruvian, Chinese, Nepalese, Italian, and other restaurants, as well as cafes, a rare book store, children’s stores and a number of boutiques, salons, yoga studios, and so much more! It is also walking distance to Fresh Pond Reservoir which provides a beautiful 2+ mile walking/running loop that feels removed from the city life. Trader Joe’s, While Foods, CVS, Apple Cinemas and more are a five minute drive down the road. It’s a wonderful neighborhood where people are friendly and there is lots to do!

name: Cambridge home near Davis, Porter, Harvard Squares
description: Our home is available August 2024. Our 3 bedroom apartment is on the second and third  floors of our 2-family home on quiet, pretty Hollis Street, steps from Davis Square (Somerville) and Porter Square (Cambridge), and Harvard Square. which is 1.5 miles away. You won't need a car - we are next to public transportation to Boston, its colleges and medical centers, and all surrounding communities. You can walk anywhere!
neighborhood_overview:
This is a safe neighborhood with a lot of open space. Besides our yard, which is considered large by city standards, there is a school with public playing fields, two playgrounds, and public tennis courts at the end of the street on Rindge Avenue. Right around the corner, on Sherman Street, there is a giant public park - Danehy Park - with playgrounds and playing fields, trails for walking and jogging, and in the winter, a giant hill for sledding.

The location gets even more perfect....You can get easily anywhere and everywhere from Hollis Street without a car. Walk, bike, or take public transportation. You will be close to the major universities, museums, medical centers, and other attractions of the Boston- Cambridge area. Hip Davis Square (Somerville) is just short five -minute walk, with its historic movie theater and great restaurants. There are many other restaurants right around the corner on Massachusetts Avenue, like Urban Kitchen (American), Café Barada (Middle-Eas
host_about:
I'm a college professor, with a husband and 3 grown kids and Cambridge is our home. We have a two family house in North Cambridge that was built in 1926. My husband, Gerry, and I live in the upstairs apartment and our first floor apartment is available for short and long-term guests. 

We also have a 3 bedroom cottage a few steps from Nantucket Sound in Harwich Port Cape Cod.  Sometimes we rent our cottage to guests in the summer months.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is in Cambridgeport, a charming neighborhood just west of MIT’s campus. It’s a historic area known for Victorian-era homes and tree-lined streets, where the bordering Charles River adds to the neighborhood’s natural allure. In fact, Magazine Beach offers a scenic riverside escape here, making it perfect for picnics or leisurely strolls. Foodies enjoy an eclectic restaurant scene, with plenty of global cuisine, bakeries, and cocktail bars. This neighborhood perfectly balances the comforts of residential living with the vibrancy of city life. It’s a highly desirable spot just north of Boston. For those taking transportation into or out of the neighborhood, the Kendall/MIT or Central stops on the T are a just a short walk away.

name: Exceptional & Modern Cambridge home
description:
This spacious, light-filled townhouse is an oasis of calm that’s close to everything. Come back from a visit to Harvard or MIT, a walk along the river, the Marathon, or a Sox game and enter a home full of pleasant surprises from museum-quality art to jewelbox bathrooms to a shaded back patio.

neighborhood_overview:
Cambridgeport is an old residential neighborhood that's close to everything. It's an easy walk from the house to Harvard Yard (23 minutes), MIT's Great Dome (17), the Charles River (12), Fenway Park (35) and the Central Square T stop (8).

The area has everything: iconic live-music venues; speakeasy-ish bars, food from all over the world — even a dispensary ;). There's a kid-friendly park a block away, two of the world's top universities nearby, and serendipity in every direction.

name: Your Classic Triple Decker near Harvard and MIT!
description:
Five-Star Accommodations hosted by an Airbnb SuperHost - Your comfortable oasis in a fantastic location!
Hardwood floors, exposed brick, kitchen island, radiant floor heating, and central air conditioning, just to name a few of the amenities!
A delightful spot with 2 bedrooms on a quiet tree-lined street.
Easy walking distance to MIT, Harvard, Central Square T station, cafes, theater, restaurants, parks, the Charles River, and across the river to Boston!
neighborhood_overview:
Your Cambridge hub! Located in the residential Cambridge neighborhood of Cambridgeport, the apartment is a five-minute walk from Central Square where you'll find the subway as well as many restaurants and shops. Easy walk to MIT and jump on the subway to travel one stop to Harvard Square (or walk, it's just over a mile!)
Boston is just across the river. Take the Red Line subway three stops and you'll be at Boston Common.
host_about: Hello! I'm Liesl - and yes, my mother was a fan of "The Sound of Music"! Originally from New Jersey, I came to Boston for college and after a couple years living in Europe, I returned to make my home here. I've lived in Fenway, Beacon Hill, the South End and now in Jamaica Plain with my husband and two teenage sons. Many years working in the travel industry gave me a great background for my shift to  hospitality. I love working with travelers and we've had guests from all over the world - so interesting to hear your stories and what brings you to Boston. I would love to host you and give you all the inside info about what makes Boston a great place to visit!
